Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
OVERVIEW 

Looking for a start up in the cyber security space building cutting-edge innovative products? Modat is seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our team. Get ready to help us build and maintain high-performance, scalable, and reliable applications. You’ll be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and deploying our machine learning technologies to support our services, as well as collaborating with other developers, product managers, and stakeholders. Also, you’ll be working in a startup company that operates in an environment with experienced professionals. 




Goal of the role: to design, implement, and optimize machine learning models to solve specific security research problems and drive innovation.

 

THE ROLE  

Incorporate internally trained LLMs into specific workflows  
Create and implement ML models for batch and real-time applications  
Monitor and adjust the performance of deployed models 
Develop algorithms for offensive and defensive security measures  
Evaluate model performance using statistical techniques and refine models based on feedback 
Query, integrate, analyze, and preprocess datasets to extract features and insights  
Code reviews, testing, and documentation to ensure code quality  
Build relationships with and understand the problems of stakeholders  
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in machine learning and apply new techniques as appropriate 




ABOUT YOU  

A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field 
Proven experience as an ML Engineer or Data Scientist (preferably in cybersecurity) 
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++ 
Understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and statistics. 
Experience with ML frameworks/libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, HuggingFace, LangChain 
Familiarity with CI/CD systems (GitHub Actions, Jenkins)  
Familiarity with big data processing frameworks (Apache Spark, Hadoop) 
Proven track record delivering ML/AI products or publishing research  
Collaborative problem solver with experience in iterative solutions  
Ability to stay updated on ML, cybersecurity advancements  
Problem-solving skills and critical thinking about security 
Excellent communication and teamwork skills  
Knowledge/interest in cybersecurity  
Experience in an agile environment 
Comfortable working in a fast-paced start up culture 

 

If you are interested in applying for this position, please send your resume to hr@modat.io with the subject line "ML Engineer"

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview:

In FRISS, we enable insurers worldwide to automatically detect potential insurance fraud. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance. Are you ready for an adventure? We are on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer!







Position Overview:

This role offers the flexibility to work from our vibrant office in Utrecht, Netherlands, or remotely from home. As part of our collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to share knowledge and work alongside other AI practitioners.







Key Responsibilities:

Implement scalable and efficient Machine Learning (ML) models.
Contribute to our in-house code libraries following good software development principles and practices.
Deploy our ML models in the cloud and monitor their performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into products.







Requirements:

Great understanding of and experience in building ML (and deep learning) models.
Excellent programming skills in Python; knowledge in SQL and Py/Spark is a plus.
Hands-on experience with MLOps; CI/CD pipelines, model deployment and monitoring.
Prior work using ML frameworks such as PyTorch (or Keras), Scikit-learn, pandas.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication skills in English.







Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs), efficient ML (quantization, distillation etc.) and transfer learning and fine-tuning.
Experience with Azure Services including Azure Datalake/Datahouse and Azure Databricks.
Experience with Rest API.
Familiarity with containerized (Docker) applications and Kubernetes.







What We Offer:

A stimulating and innovative work environment.
Flexible working options: 50/50 work from our Utrecht office or home.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative team culture where knowledge sharing is encouraged.







Apply Now:

If you are ready to play a crucial role at FRISS, we want to hear from you! Apply now via recruitment@friss.com to become our ML Engineer at FRISS and make a meaningful impact on our success.




Please note; We are only accepting applications from candidates based in the Netherlands.







About FRISS:

FRISS is a leading provider in fraud detection and risk mitigation solutions for the insurance industry. Founded in 2006, FRISS holds its head office in Utrecht, The Netherlands, with a global presence and global workforce, including Europe, the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance.

To learn more about FRISS, have a look at www.friss.com.

FRISS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage you to be yourself. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religious affiliation, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, nationality, or veteran status.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Why Recharge.com

We are the leading one-stop-shop for branded payments, making online recharge possible for anyone, anywhere at any time — whether you or someone you love needs credit for calling, gaming, entertainment or money. This is your chance to join an ambitious scaleup in a state of rapid growth; we’ll push you to develop yourself and help you create a real impact in your role. Put simply: we could write history together.

We won’t bore you with a corporate spiel about how we might be taking on the world of branded payments (spoiler: we are). Instead, we’ll let the numbers speak for themselves: we bring consumers their favourite brands to their fingertips, with over 15,000 products available in every gift card category globally, $70 million in funding (and counting!), 20%+ growth in 2023. We also have a revenue target of €75 million in 2024, we're just getting started with 1.1 million app downloads in 2023, we are counting 5.0+ million active customers, a presence in 180 countries and 25 markets, a team of 150+ employees and 35+ nationalities, and 1 person missing — you.

We’re on the hunt for the hungriest and most passionate talent out there. If at any point your brain screams “I want in!” while you’re reading this, then consider this the sign you’ve been looking for: we want you too.

The role

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our Business Intelligence Team reporting to Nicolas Arrivé. You will work on improving our day to day business operations. You understand what kind of insights drive the right action. You have great analytical skills and are good at making people understand what needs to get done and why.

The BI team embeds actionable insights into the business teams, and drives commercial success (improving sales, margin and/or efficiency). Automation is also at the heart of our business practices when value can be extracted at scale.

What will I do?

As a Data Scientist you will play a vital part in defining our company strategy and execution across Payment flow, Paid Marketing, Customer base and product strategy.

You are part of the Business Intelligence team and you are the technical expert in modelling, testing and analytical techniques helping us analysing millions of consumer transactions.

You are modelling from scratch or improving existing statistical models aiming (among other things) at: predicting and explaining Churn, predicting and explaining next likely brand/transaction to happen, existing Marketing Mix Models, automating anomaly detection, existing Lifetime Value prediction model and many more core operational predictive processes. You can articulate the pros and cons of a given approach to numerous stakeholders.

You perform ad hoc advanced strategic analyses and turn these into KPIs that are relevant and easy to understand.

You are a de-facto code reviewer for the rest of the team for the code base you are the most proficient with.

You are improving the automation of some of our reporting tools (Tableau server and front end) for the most important views and KPIs the business relies on to make daily or weekly decisions & you are coaching and mentoring the rest of the team as you see fit on all things technical.

What you have:


3+ years experience in an analytics and/or data-science related field (preferably within the e-commerce industry)
3+ years experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets as well as data extraction tools such as Hive and/or SQL
Solid understanding of testing and modelling statistics (R2, p-value, t-test etc…)
3+ year experience with statistical software such as R, or coding language: Python
3+ years Experience with Data Visualisation tools (like Tableau and PowerBI ideally)
Hands-on experience with setting up test studies: A/B tests, Geo-experimentation and Lift studies



Nice to have:


Advanced knowledge of Customer, Marketing Analytics and modelling such as price elasticity test and formula, Marketing Mix Models, LifeTime Value calculations etc…
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Sociology or similar
Very advanced knowledge of Python or R



What We Offer


30 days of holiday, a great pension scheme and one of the best relocation packages in Amsterdam
Flexible working hours and an office overlooking the Amstel
Macbook Pro or Windows Laptop
Budget for noise-canceling headphones, travel to and from the office, working-from-home and self-learning
Free healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks by our in-house chef
Free Dutch classes to help out with daily life in the Netherlands
Regular parties, celebrations and other events



The process


Apply: Want in? Let us know! Apply for a role and help us get to know your best self.
Phone interview: One of our recruiters will get in touch to help you both understand if Recharge is the right next move for you.
First interview: You’ll meet with your future line manager (either in person or online) to talk about you, our culture and whether you're a fit for the job.
Assignment & Second interview: Some roles involve a case study. Great! It’s your chance to shine and show us you have what it takes. You’ll present your case study to the Hiring Manager and someone from the team
Third Interview: You’ll meet with a key member of the management team
Offer: You did it! There are only a few tickets available, and this one has your name on it. Welcome to the team.
Show more

What We Offer

  • 30 days of holiday, a great pension scheme and one of the best relocation packages in Amsterdam

  • Macbook Pro or Windows Laptop
  • Budget for noise-canceling headphones, travel to and from the office, working-from-home and self-learning
  • Free healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks by our in-house chef
  • Free Dutch classes to help out with daily life in the Netherlands
  • Regular parties, celebrations and other events


The process

  • Apply: Want in? Let us know! Apply for a role and help us get to know your best self.
  • Phone interview: One of our recruiters will get in touch to help you both understand if Recharge is the right next move for you.
  • First interview: You’ll meet with your future line manager (either in person or online) to talk about you, our culture and whether you're a fit for the job.

  • Offer: You did it! There are only a few tickets available, and this one has your name on it. Welcome to the team.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you enjoy solving problems, looking at problems through a different lens, and working closely with customers to innovate new solutions to complex problems? Do you jump with excitement at the opportunity to identify trends and provide unique business solutions? Do you want to join a team where learning about a new technology or solution is part of our work every day?

The Industry Solutions Engineering (ISE) team is a global engineering organization that works directly with customers looking to leverage the latest technologies to address their toughest challenges. We work closely with our customers’ engineers to jointly develop code for cloud-based solutions that can accelerate their organization. We work in collaboration with Microsoft product teams, partners, and open-source communities to empower our customers to do more with the cloud. We pride ourselves in using, and making contributions to, open source and assisting our product teams to make our tools and platforms easier to use.

We develop solutions side-by-side with our customers through collaborative innovation to solve their challenges. This work involves the development of broadly applicable, high-impact solution patterns and open-source software assets that contribute to the Microsoft platform. In this role, you will be working with engineers from your team and our customers’ teams to apply your skills, perspectives, and creativity to grow as engineers and help solve our customers’ toughest challenges.

We are hiring a Data Scientist with deep expertise in machine learning and AI and experience in developing production quality solutions which deliver a huge business impact. The ideal candidate should also have deep industry experience in either Manufacturing, Energy, Mobility, Telecommunications sectors. As part of our team, you will be working side-by-side with high-impact engineers and strategic customers to solve complex problems. You will communicate trends and innovative solutions to stakeholders. You will work cross-functionally with several teams including engineering crews, product teams, and program management to deploy business solutions.

Our team prides itself on embracing a growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging everyone to share their unique viewpoints and be their authentic selves. Join us and help create life-changing innovations that impact billions around the world!

Responsibilities

Business Understanding and Impact 


Leads data-science projects or teams to align with business needs and deliver value. 
Brings new value to the business by leveraging your industry experience in terms of where resources and business needs should be allocated.
Leverages extensive experience to drive best practices for discovering, implementing, and maintaining transformative data-science solutions for customers.


Data Preparation and Understanding 


Leads data acquisition and understanding efforts for engineering projects using various tools and techniques. 


Modeling and Statistical Analysis 


Develops and applies ML frameworks and best practices for scalable and ethical solutions. 
Has deep mathematical understanding of statistics and machine learning
Incorporates best practices for ML modeling with consideration for artificial intelligence (AI) ethics.  


Evaluation 


Review, supports and provides best practices for data analysis and modeling techniques. 
Ensures selected modeling techniques are appropriate and align with desired project outcomes.
Decide on the next steps (e.g., deployment, further iterations, new projects). 


Industry and Research Knowledge/Opportunity Identification 


Serves as industry thought leader in data science in either of following fields: Manufacturing, Energy, Mobility, Telecommunications. 
Provides feedback, drives improvement, and shares knowledge as a data science and industry expert. 
Apply deep expertise to drive novel customer experiences, including early access engineering programs.  
Applies expertise to mitigate technical customer escalations.


Coding and Debugging 


Writes and debugs code for complex projects and leads solution development. 


Business Management 


Leads ML and data-science partnerships and IP improvement. 
Partners with diverse Microsoft teams to identify and explore opportunities for the novel application of machine learning (ML) and other data-science tools to above industry. 


Customer/Partner Orientation 


Provides customer-oriented insights and solutions by understanding the business, product, data, and customer perspective. 
Develops new techniques/methodologies for building solutions for a specific business need based on available data.  


Qualifications

Required Qualifications:


Doctorate in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
OR Master's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
OR Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND data science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
OR equivalent experience.
Customer-facing, project-delivery experience, professional services, and/or consulting experience.

Preferred Qualifications;


Experience working as part of geographically dispersed, diverse, and virtual teams.
Enjoy travel and are comfortable with travel up to 25%.
Demonstrated ability to work with customers and collaborate across company boundaries.


Our team prides itself on embracing a growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging everyone to share their unique viewpoints and be their authentic selves. Join us and help create life-changing innovations that impact billions around the world!

At Microsoft, we are seeking people who have a passion for the positive impact technology can have on communities and for making a difference in the world. Within ISE, you will find a wide range of backgrounds, perspectives, personal and cultural experiences which are vital to our success with our customers.  It’s an informal and flexible work environment and you’ll be welcome to work in the way that best enables you to get your job done.

We invest in your health, wellness, and financial future by offering a competitive package including a wide range of benefits built around your personal needs and those close to you.  

#ISEngineering

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer / MLOPS ENGINEER – Leading Media Group - The Hague




A leading Media company based in The Hague is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer / MLOps engineer to work alongside a team of Machine Learning Engineers, Mobile, Backend and Frontend developers and UX Designers.




As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Pushing ML models in production, productionizing machine learning models
Helping with the integration of machine learning in the business, with high availability and limited downtime
Working closely with Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientist to impact the business
Guiding more junior team members into seniority.




Required skills and experience, to be successful in this role;

Python
Databricks
MLOps (operational side of Machine Learning Engineering)
Matlab (plus!)
Streamlit (plus!)
Automation mindset!




The team is a small team of 8 engineers dedicated to Machine Learning Engineering.




Strong benefits will be included in this role!




If this fantastic opportunity sounds of interest, please apply here to have a confidential conversation in more detail!

Title: AI/MLops Engineer
Description:
About Us:

At Lensor, we’re at the cutting edge of automotive AI, creating solutions that automate vehicle inspections. As a spin-off from PON, we blend the stability of an established company with the innovation and energy of a start-up. Our young, dynamic team is passionate about developing AI-driven products that make a tangible impact. With a culture that values creativity, diversity, and fun, we’re looking for talented individuals to join us in Amsterdam or remotely as we expand our operations.




Role Overview:

As an AI/ML Ops Engineer at Lensor, you’ll play a crucial role in deploying and managing AI/ML models, optimizing our infrastructure, and ensuring seamless integration across various platforms. This role offers a unique opportunity to work on innovative projects while growing your skills in a dynamic, supportive environment. You'll have the chance to shape the future of our product as we implement our solutions for customers.




What You’ll Do:

Model Deployment and Integration: Design, implement, and maintain scalable machine learning pipelines and deploy models to production with high availability.
Infrastructure and Automation: Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for ML model deployment and automate testing/validation workflows.
Data Preprocessing and Engineering: Work with large datasets to perform data cleaning, normalization, and transformation, and manage third-party data annotation processes.
Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor model performance, data drift, and implement robust logging and alerting systems.
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with AI Engineers and developers to streamline ML processes and communicate improvements.
Security and Compliance: Ensure all AI/ML operations comply with data privacy and security regulations.




Who You Are:

Python Proficient: Strong experience in Python and testing frameworks, with a solid foundation in software engineering.
AI/ML Enthusiast: Experience or strong interest in AI/ML technologies, with a desire to contribute to innovative projects.
Collaborative Team Player: You thrive in an international, dynamic environment and enjoy working closely with a diverse team.
Innovative Problem Solver: You’re creative, resourceful, and eager to tackle challenges in a fast-paced start-up.




What We Offer:

Innovation Days: Time to work on your own creative projects and initiatives.
Flexibility: A flexible, supportive work environment that values work-life balance.
Growth Opportunities: Endless opportunities to expand your skills and career in a growing start-up.
Strong Foundation: Stability from being part of PON, while enjoying the agility of a start-up.
Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, excellent pension scheme, and visa sponsorship, including 30% tax ruling support.
Tools & Equipment: MacBook, cell phone, and all necessary tools to excel in your role.
Generous Time Off: 20 vacation days plus an additional individual choice budget for extra leave.
Development Opportunities: Participate in summer and winter labs, training, and courses to enhance your skills.
Pon Fit Program: Access to fitness activities like bootcamps, running events, and more.
Health & Discounts: Collective health insurance discounts and staff discounts on Pon products.







Core Values at Lensor:

Pioneering Spirit: Passion for AI and technology, constantly pushing boundaries.
Customer Focus: Delivering solutions that solve real-world problems.
Innovation: Creativity and risk-taking are at the heart of what we do.
Community: Embracing diversity, fostering collaboration, and supporting each other’s growth.




How to Apply:

Are you as enthusiastic as we are about Lensor? Then we are looking forward to meeting you! Click on apply and upload your Motivation and CV!

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About ITsPeople

ITsPeople is a leading management and consulting firm specializing in guiding organizations through complex digital transformations and enhancing their organizational agility. We empower our clients to navigate and overcome intricate business challenges by leveraging data-driven insights and managing large-scale transformation projects. Our mission is to help companies strengthen their market position by adopting advanced data analytics and AI, fostering a culture of agility, and driving sustained operational excellence.




Role Overview

As a Data Scientist at ITsPeople, you will be instrumental in transforming data into actionable insights that support our clients' strategic objectives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve complex problems, develop predictive models, and drive data-driven decision-making. This role is ideal for a highly analytical individual with a passion for uncovering patterns and insights from large datasets and communicating these findings effectively.




Key Responsibilities

Data Collection and Preparation: Gather, clean, and prepare large datasets from various sources for analysis, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Conduct exploratory analyses to discover trends, patterns, and anomalies in data, providing valuable insights to stakeholders.
Predictive and Diagnostic Modeling: Develop, implement, and evaluate machine learning models and algorithms to predict outcomes and diagnose issues.
Machine Learning and AI: Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to build models that address business challenges and optimize processes.
Data Visualization and Reporting: Create compelling visualizations and dashboards to communicate data insights and support decision-making processes.
Collaboration and Teamwork: Work closely with project teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and domain experts, to understand requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Continuous Learning and Improvement: Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data science and technology to continually improve methodologies and tools.




Required Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience: 0 to 3 years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related role. We welcome enthusiastic individuals looking to start or advance their career in data science.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools such as Jupyter Notebook, Tableau, or similar platforms. Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow) is a plus.
Soft Skills: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate effectively within teams.
Language skills: Fluency in Dutch and English is required.




Personal Attributes

Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Detail Oriented: Attention to detail in data analysis, modeling, and reporting, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables.
Proactive and Driven: Self-motivated and proactive in seeking out new challenges and opportunities to apply data science.
Team Player: Collaborative spirit with the ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams and contribute to a positive team dynamic.
Personal Leadership: Demonstrates initiative, responsibility, and the ability to lead and inspire others without formal authority.




Training and Development

At ITsPeople, we believe in the growth and development of our team members. We offer a robust training program designed to equip new and emerging professionals with the skills and knowledge needed to excel in their roles. Our comprehensive training covers the latest in data science techniques, tools, and industry best practices, providing you with the foundation to succeed and grow within our dynamic team.




Why Join ITsPeople?

Joining ITsPeople means being part of a vibrant and supportive team dedicated to driving transformative change for our clients through data-driven solutions. We value innovation, collaboration, and a customer-centric approach. As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects, engage with a diverse range of clients, and contribute significantly to their success.




We offer a stimulating work environment that promotes professional development and personal growth. You will have the autonomy to manage your projects, collaborate with senior consultants, and play a key role in our data-driven strategies.

Title: Data Scientist (Smart Agriculture)
Description:
Lay the groundwork for tomorrow with Kubota!




Since 1890, Kubota has evolved in a unique way worldwide. With a strong will to solve problems in food, water and the environment, we have leveraged our strength as a manufacturer and a solutions provider. Spanning across 120+ countries and employing more than 50,000 people in Asia, Europe and North America, Kubota generates revenue in excess of $20 billion. From agricultural and industrial machinery, and overall water solutions, to any other living environment solution, our question, and our challenge was always the same: what can we do to meet the demands and enhance our lives for tomorrow? Explore this exciting career opportunity and join us on the journey as we seek to be an “Essentials Innovator for Supporting Life”.




My job, Our future




Kubota Technology Innovation Europe department

The KTI-EU organization is a newly established department focusing on digital solutions and systems development from both a fundamental and applied research perspective. It bridges the gap between the market research, collaborations and technology mapping (driven by our Innovation Center Europe) and the commercial development done by our R&D centers, like Kubota Research and Development Europe and Kverneland Group. The KTI department centers itself on the European market but in strong collaboration with the global organization and other regional offices e.g., KTI-SV (Silicon Valley, USA) to align and coordinate global initiatives.




In this context and in order to strengthen our team, we are looking to recruit a Data Scientist. This activity is related to analyzing agricultural data, developing predictive models and providing actionable insights to drive informed decision-making in the field of smart agriculture. Not only just analyzing the data, but also be responsible for planning and executing field experiments, including how to collect the data (when, where, how often, with which sensor, what). Therefore, in addition to agricultural knowledge, sensors knowledge like RGB, multi/hyper-spectral, thermal, etc is also required. The contribution is broad, including agricultural crop monitoring, machine monitoring, autonomous driving, monitoring of quality of agricultural work while working with tractors and agricultural implements. This is a critical role for the success of our technology advancements pushing the boundaries of productivity and sustainability.




Responsibilities:

Define and design experiments from data collection to evaluation and support actual data collection in fields

Collecting, cleaning, and analyzing agricultural data to identify patterns and trends
Building predictive models to optimize crop yield, field operation and farm management
Utilize statistical analysis and machine learning techniques to derive insights from agricultural data.
Reflect the results of experimental planning and sensing data analysis in the sensor system
Research relevant papers, formulate a hypothesis, and explore the best approach
Technical information collection, reporting, and evaluation of the AI integrated agricultural products, related sensors.
Work within joint research projects with external local and international partners.




Requirements:

Master’s or Ph.D. in data science, agricultural engineering, or a related field
Proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization
Experience with agricultural data analysis and understanding of farming practices
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or similar
Fluent in English
Communication skills for requirement definition or alignment of specs with global stakeholders by documentation, design reviews, etc.




Nice to have:

Experience of mobile sensing data analysis
Experience of sensor development and sensors knowledge such as RGB, multi/hyper-spectral, thermal sensors
Italian, Spanish or French language proficiency
Experience of collaboration with team members from various backgrounds.
Experience in agricultural mechanistic modeling as well as statistical modeling.
Experience with GIS (Geographic Information Systems)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My client within the investment management sector are looking for an experienced data scientist to help build predictive models with a focus on sustainability and ESG risk!




Responsibilities:




• Designing new predictive models and refining existing models to analyze and forecast the mortgage market, with a focus on sustainability and ESG risks.

• Perform in-depth analyses that allow direct advice on portfolio management to our investors, with a balance between risk and return.

• Create innovative reports and whitepapers to share our findings with investors and stakeholders. You will also present these analyses yourself and discuss them with investors.

• Working with the wider team, providing investors with monthly information about their investment portfolio




Requirements:




• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (operations research, finance, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• 2+ years of industry experience

• Knowledge of machine learning models is a plus

• Excellent quantitative modelling skills

• Strong command of the Dutch language




Salary Package:




• Up to €90,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• 2 days per week in the office

• Annual bonus.

• Pension plan

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About OLYX :




OLYX is a brokerage company located in the heart of Amsterdam, active in the dynamic world of renewable energies. We are convinced that human relationships and trust are essential ingredients in trading. We have intermediated over 9 billion euros of total deal value through over 700 trading partners in Europe, Asia, and South America. 

We are proud of our company culture and the results achieved by our team, which consists of around 40 people from many different nationalities. We celebrate our successes together and are always looking for improvements. 

Be part of our future, and let’s thrive together! 




About the job:

 

OLYX is looking for a full-time Data Scientist to join our dynamic and innovative Data Team. As part of a fast-growing company, our Data Team plays a key role in driving the flow of information within and beyond OLYX. In our team, you will collaborate closely with a small group of enthusiastic talents, leveraging your analytical skills and creativity to extract valuable insights from data and inspire impactful business decisions.




Responsibilities: 




Provide actionable insights to support business strategy and decision making through advanced data analytics, reporting, and visualization.
Own the design and delivery of data science solutions for brokers and other stakeholders to enhance market intelligence for the business.
Collaborate with software developers, product owners, and business analysts to integrate data analytical tools into software products.




About you: 




Fluent in English
1- 3 years experience in a Data Scientist role
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with data science libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, and Matplotlib.
Proven experience with data analysis workflows, including data loading, cleaning, transformation, and visualization.
Experience with SQL and relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL), designing queries for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with software development best practices, including version control (Git), use of development environments, and working within agile methodologies.
Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
Bonus points for knowledge of the product design process and translating business needs into technical requirements.
Bonus points for applied understanding of machine learning algorithms, model building, and evaluation processes to solve real-world business problems.




You may be a good fit if: 




You take ownership of your ideas and proactively bring them to the table. You get excited about sharing and presenting your data insights in a clear and engaging manner.
You can inspire others with your ideas and bring positive energy to the team. You enjoy collaborating in a diverse company and team of different disciplines.
You are unafraid to experiment, push boundaries, and try new things. You thrive in an environment that encourages learning and experimentation. Fail fast, learn faster.
You get excited about the opportunity to solve complex problems and enjoy working through challenges. You are proactive in identifying potential roadblocks and seeking solutions to overcome them.

 

What’s in it for you? 




An Inspiring Work Environment: Enjoy a young, vibrant, and inspiring work atmosphere at OLYX. 
A Supportive Team: Be part of a multicultural and supportive team, where your qualitative as well as quantitative contributions are highly valued. 
Competitive Compensation: You’ll receive competitive remuneration and have the opportunity to earn bonuses through your contributions. 
Wellness and Team Building: Participate in team-building events and enjoy a healthy lunch provided daily. 
Growth Opportunities: OLYX is committed to fostering your future career growth and offers tailored personal development opportunities. 
The Annual OLYX Trip: Join us on our yearly OLYX trip, a chance to relax and celebrate our successes.




Show more

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - LLM
Description:
LLM - Python for Machine Learning

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2 years, Python for Data Science: min 1 yr, Machine Learning: min 1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, Keras: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr

Key skills: Python, ML, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow

Job Responsibilities


Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
Implement machine learning models and preprocessing pipelines using Scikit-learn.
Apply supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forest, and k-NN, to solve complex problems.
Design and implement deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and transfer learning models.
Explore and apply reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI solutions.


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
1+ years of experience with Python-based frameworks for machine learning.
Proficiency in TensorFlow and/or PyTorch for model development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of Scikit-learn for machine learning model implementation.
In-depth understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as deep learning architectures.


Nice To Have


Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
Proficiency in Pandas and Numpy for data manipulation and preprocessing.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.


Skills: python,keras,k-nn,supervised learning,reinforcement learning,algorithms,pytorch,rnns,deep learning,pandas,numpy,svm,tensorflow,random forest,gans,cnns,large language models (llms),scikit-learn,unsupervised learning,ai,transfer learning,data science,ml,decision trees,machine learning,learning

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Why Recharge.com

We are the leading one-stop-shop for branded payments, making online recharge possible for anyone, anywhere at any time — whether you or someone you love needs credit for calling, gaming, entertainment or money. This is your chance to join an ambitious scaleup in a state of rapid growth; we’ll push you to develop yourself and help you create a real impact in your role. Put simply: we could write history together.




We won’t bore you with a corporate spiel about how we might be taking on the world of branded payments (spoiler: we are). Instead, we’ll let the numbers speak for themselves: we bring consumers their favourite brands to their fingertips, with over 15,000 products available in every gift card category globally, $70 million in funding (and counting!), 20%+ growth in 2023. We also have a revenue target of €75 million in 2024, we're just getting started with 1.1 million app downloads in 2023, we are counting 5.0+ million active customers, a presence in 180 countries and 25 markets, a team of 150+ employees and 35+ nationalities, and 1 person missing — you.




We’re on the hunt for the hungriest and most passionate talent out there. If at any point your brain screams “I want in!” while you’re reading this, then consider this the sign you’ve been looking for: we want you too.




The role

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our Business Intelligence Team reporting to Nicolas Arrivé. You will work on improving our day to day business operations. You understand what kind of insights drive the right action. You have great analytical skills and are good at making people understand what needs to get done and why.




The BI team embeds actionable insights into the business teams, and drives commercial success (improving sales, margin and/or efficiency). Automation is also at the heart of our business practices when value can be extracted at scale.




What will I do?

As a Data Scientist you will play a vital part in defining our company strategy and execution across Payment flow, Paid Marketing, Customer base and product strategy.




You are part of the Business Intelligence team and you are the technical expert in modelling, testing and analytical techniques helping us analysing millions of consumer transactions.




You are modelling from scratch or improving existing statistical models aiming (among other things) at: predicting and explaining Churn, predicting and explaining next likely brand/transaction to happen, existing Marketing Mix Models, automating anomaly detection, existing Lifetime Value prediction model and many more core operational predictive processes. You can articulate the pros and cons of a given approach to numerous stakeholders.




You perform ad hoc advanced strategic analyses and turn these into KPIs that are relevant and easy to understand.

You are a de-facto code reviewer for the rest of the team for the code base you are the most proficient with.




You are improving the automation of some of our reporting tools (Tableau server and front end) for the most important views and KPIs the business relies on to make daily or weekly decisions & you are coaching and mentoring the rest of the team as you see fit on all things technical.




What you have:

3+ years experience in an analytics and/or data-science related field (preferably within the e-commerce industry)
3+ years experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets as well as data extraction tools such as Hive and/or SQL
Solid understanding of testing and modelling statistics (R2, p-value, t-test etc…)
3+ year experience with statistical software such as R, or coding language: Python
3+ years Experience with Data Visualisation tools (like Tableau and PowerBI ideally)
Hands-on experience with setting up test studies: A/B tests, Geo-experimentation and Lift studies




Nice to have:

Advanced knowledge of Customer, Marketing Analytics and modelling such as price elasticity test and formula, Marketing Mix Models, LifeTime Value calculations etc…
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Sociology or similar
Very advanced knowledge of Python or R




What we offer

30 days of holiday, a great pension scheme and one of the best relocation packages in Amsterdam
Flexible working hours and an office overlooking the Amstel
Macbook Pro or Windows Laptop
Budget for noise-canceling headphones, travel to and from the office, working-from-home and self-learning
Free healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks by our in-house chef
Free Dutch classes to help out with daily life in the Netherlands
Regular parties, celebrations and other events




The process

1. Apply: Want in? Let us know! Apply for a role and help us get to know your best self.

2. Phone interview: One of our recruiters will get in touch to help you both understand if Recharge is the right next move for you.

3. First interview: You’ll meet with your future line manager (either in person or online) to talk about you, our culture and whether you're a fit for the job.

4. Assignment & Second interview: Some roles involve a case study. Great! It’s your chance to shine and show us you have what it takes. You’ll present your case study to the Hiring Manager and someone from the team

5. Third Interview: You’ll meet with a key member of the management team

6. Offer: You did it! There are only a few tickets available, and this one has your name on it. Welcome to the team.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Utrecht Omgeving - Retail - Fulltime




Breng dit data team naar een hoger niveau met je expertise in ML/AI! en jij een expert in het benutten van AI/ML en kun je Data Scientists helpen bij het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van productieklare modellen? Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het data analytics team voor een grote retailer in Nederland. Jij bent de specialist in MLOps en Cloud Computing, verantwoordelijk voor het productieklaar maken van AI/ML-oplossingen. Hiermee sla je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega's (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistiek, assortimentsoptimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.




Werkzaamheden:




Je werkt samen met het Data Science-team om sterke AI/ML-modellen te creëren, waarbij je zorgt voor grondige monitoring van de proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om fouten en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
Je biedt advies en oplossingen voor technische uitdagingen die zich tijdens het ontwikkelingsproces voordoen.
Als specialist in MLOps en CI/CD onderhoud en verbeter je continu de modellen.
Je fungeert als verbindingspersoon tussen Data Science en Global IT voor het gebruik van technologieën zoals Databricks en Azure, die door Global IT worden beheerd.
Je draagt actief bij aan de vooruitgang van technologie en tools door het ontwikkelen van utility packages en het verder ontwikkelen van MLOps-methodologie.
Je blijft op de hoogte van innovaties binnen MLOps en bepaalt hoe deze kunnen bijdragen aan de doelen.







Wat zit erin voor jou?




Een dynamische omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren en plezier hebt door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding
24 vakantiedagen en extra dagen op fulltime basis.
Mogelijkheid tot 19 extra vakantiedagen + mogelijkheid tot kopen of verkopen van vakantiedagen
Korting bij de retailer zelf
Leer- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met een interne academy.
2-3 dagen per week vanuit huis kunnen werken, flexibele uren
Kilometer vergoeding voor reis naar het kantoor.




Wie ben jij?

3+ jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of Data Scientist met affiniteit voor ML
Expertise in Python, PySpark en SQL
Ervaring met MLOps/ CI/CD cyclus en Git
Werken in scrumteams
Kennis van Databricks en Azure
Teamspirit en kunnen sparren met je collega's om zo mogelijke oplossingen voor te leggen.
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels




Ben jij de juiste fit? Neem nu contact op :)

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist

Als Senior Data Scientist (speaking dutch fluently) bij Ordina Sopra steria werk je aan gave uitdagende projecten in een divers team van collega-data scientisten. Jouw expertise en ambities vormen de basis voor onze High-Performance Teams (HPT's), waarin samenwerking en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan. Iedereen draagt bij vanuit zijn eigen vakmanschap en technologie. Zo blijf je van elkaar leren en sta je er dus nooit alleen voor. Gespecialiseerd in NLP en LLM's, sta je aan de frontlinie van het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde NLP-oplossingen.




Werken als Senior Data Scientist bij Ordina Sopra steria

Je staat aan de frontlinie van het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde NLP-oplossingen.
Je overbrugt de kloof tussen opkomende technologieën en zakelijke behoeften.
Je biedt begeleiding en mentorship aan collega's en klanten op jouw expertisegebieden.
Je brengt innovatieve ideeën in om het Data Science-team te versterken.
Je maakt gebruik van de meest recente machine learning modellen en deep learning algoritmes.




Waar jij komt te werken

Je komt terecht in een team van 20 data scientists die werken aan verschillende projecten, voornamelijk in multidisciplinaire teams bij verschillende organisaties. We werken aan een breed scala aan ML-projecten, en hebben een van de drie kernfocuspunten op Grote Taalmodellen. We onderzoeken, ontwikkelen en valideren grote taalmodel(len) (assets) zoals document intelligentie en zoeken en implementeren ze in productie bij onze klanten.




Het gebied bestaat uit vijf praktijken: Data Governance en Data Management, Data Visualisatie, Data Science en AI, Data Engineering en Data Migraties, en Ruimtelijke Intelligentie. Elk met een specifieke focus op inhoud en de juiste oplossing. Meer dan 170 professionals werken in een praktijk die logisch bij hen past. We geloven in de kracht van multidisciplinaire teams.




Dit ben jij

Je bent een enthousiaste professional in het veld van Natural Language Processing (NLP) en Large Language Models (LLM's). Als innovatieve denker ben je altijd op de hoogte van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen in de wereld van Generative AI. Je combineert technische expertise met een praktische aanpak, waarbij je niet aarzelt om complexe problemen aan te pakken, maar ook pragmatisch genoeg bent om eenvoudigere oplossingen te kiezen als die effectief zijn. Je bent een echte teamspeler die graag kennis deelt en discussieert over de laatste trends en inzichten in het vakgebied.




Kortom, je bent een gedreven NLP-specialist die het beste van twee werelden combineert: een diepgaande technische kennis van LLM's en GenAI, gekoppeld aan een praktische, resultaatgerichte benadering van probleemoplossing.




Verder neem je mee:

Bachelor en of masterdiploma
Minimaal 3-4 jaar ervaring met machine learning in productie
Ervaring met het schrijven van productieklaar code
Jouw technologiestack omvat zaken als Docker, Helm, Kubernetes, LangChain, spaCy, enz.
Ervaring met werken met LLM's (GPT, BERT, enz.)
Gevorderd niveau in Python
Je wilt grote taalmodellen testen, valideren en implementeren




Waarom Ordina Sopra steria?

Naast uitdagende werkmogelijkheden, een open werkcultuur en leuke collega’s, bieden wij jou ook de vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je professionele doelen te behalen door een ruim aanbod aan trainingen aan te bieden. Daarnaast bieden wij ook de volgende andere punten:

Een vast contract
Basis salaris tussen de €6000 en €7000 o.b.v. 40 uur
Flexibele werkomgeving waar je zelfstandig tijd en plaats kunt bepalen
Mobiliteitsbudget met keuze voor een leaseauto of eigen vervoer
Flex benefit budget en collectieve regelingen
Keuze uit een MacBook Pro (inc Apple accessoires) of Windows laptop
Een betrokken community gericht op teambuilding, gaming en evenementen




Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren. Wij geloven namelijk in de kracht van diversiteit en waarderen inclusie. De beste ideeën en slimste oplossingen ontstaan immers in diverse teams. Daarom besteden we veel aandacht aan de samenstelling van onze high-performance teams. Zodat jij je thuis voelt en het beste uit jezelf kunt halen.




Ben je klaar om je carrière een boost te geven? Solliciteer dan direct voor de functie van Senior Data Scientist bij Ordina sopra steria!

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist (Senior 4-7 Years)

Duration: 6 months

Location: Amsterdam, NL (Hybrid – 1 to 2 days per week onsite)







Background:

Looking for data scientist with background in topics related to the following: personalisation, generative AI, marketing, recommenders, large language models, predictive modeling. Helpful if candidate has deployment expertise.
We are looking for Data science modelling for Marketing.




Desired knowledge, experience, competence, skills etc.

Demand: Data science, predictive modelling, statistics, python, bigquery, Marketing related experience, machine learning
Desire: Large language models, Generative AI.




Essential Skills:

predictive modelling, statistics, machine learning

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
MLOps Engineer / AI Engineer - Leading Investment Bank - The Hague - Hybrid remote - GenAI (RE-OPENED + URGENT ! ! !)




Together with the Director of Data Analytics of a leading Investment Bank in The Hague, I'm looking for an MLOps Engineer / Machine Learning / AI Engineer, with a focus on pushing models in production (MLOps).




This is a key position in a new small dedicated Advanced Analytics team, where you can take a pivotal role in pushing risk & ML Models into production:




Your responsibilities:

Automate, and maintain ML models using Databricks, PYTHON, AzureML and MATLAB
Collaborate with data scientists and business stakeholders to ensure ML & AI models are production-ready and meet performance standards - advise them with your MLOps knowledge!
Provide and implement innovative solutions to automate the production of AI and ML models for Predictive AI in the Risk Department
Work on GenAI and predictive modelling/AI




Teck Stack: Python, MLOps, AzureML, DataBricks, MATLAB, GUI, DevOps, Software Engineering, ETL, CICD, GenAI, PredictiveAI




Your profile:

The ideal candidate has 2/3 years experience within MLOps
Proficient in Python and designing, developing and maintaining ML models (Machine Learning models)
You've worked with Databricks, Python, AzureML, Azure Factory
Exposure to MATLAB




Environment: greenfield Data Analytics department & Centre of Expertise. They focus on implementing GenAI + Predictive AI. This department holds the largest budget of the whole bank; Innovation and Investment is at its core.




The bank offers great benefits:

32 (!!) holidays
Hyrid working from The Hague office
Best pension in the Netherlands (+30% of annual salary)
Excellent Learning & Development programs
NS Business card 1st Class




Are you a Medior - Senior Machine Learning or Data Science Engineer / Software Engineer or Data Engineer, even an AI Engineer - with experience within MLOps?




Please apply!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is an innovative startup based in the heart of Amsterdam, acquired by a leading insurance company in the UK. This strategic partnership provides them with a solid financial foundation while allowing them to maintain their startup culture and agility. Nestled in the vibrant Science Park in Amsterdam, our client is expanding their team to capitalize on their recent success.




Role Overview:

Our client is on the lookout for a skilled Data Scientist to join their dynamic team. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in uncovering valuable insights from extensive datasets, contributing to smarter decision-making, risk reduction, and improved service delivery. As they integrate with their new parent company, your primary focus will be on applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building predictive systems that enhance their product offerings.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain reproducible data pipelines from raw data sources to actionable insights, utilizing literate programming narratives.
Utilize open-source software, including command-line tools, emacs, org-mode, and a Python stack (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) for robust data solutions.
Document assumptions, hypotheses, tests, and evidence within data pipelines, ensuring transparency and traceability.
Collaborate in a hybrid Agile environment with a startup mindset, contributing to innovation and excellence.




Skills and Qualifications:

Strong understanding of current machine learning techniques and algorithms.
Proficiency in Python and experience with data science libraries (numPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, D3.js, GGplot, etc.
Familiarity with RDBMSs and proficiency in SQL.
Solid scripting and programming skills, including knowledge of bash and Unix command-line tools.
If you have a PhD in a relevant field or teaching experience, this would be considered a great asset




Offered:

Competitive salary: up to €55,000
Pension scheme for financial security
€30 net gym budget for well-being
Swappfiets subscription for convenient commuting
25 days of holiday leave for work-life balance
Hybrid work environment, combining the flexibility of remote work with collaborative in-office sessions.



Join our client at this exciting juncture as they combine the agility of a startup with the stability of an established insurance company. Apply now to be a key player in their growth story!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Utrecht, Nederland

Tot 80k + benefits




-Dutch Speaking-




Ben jij een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer met een passie voor in productie brengen van models. Word lid van een dynamisch en zelforganiserend klein adviesbureau dat flexibiliteit, samenwerking en het leveren van hoogwaardige oplossingen voor predictive klanten.




Het Bedrijf

Sinds 2015 heeft ons kleine adviesbureau zich gevestigd als een gemeenschap van data-experts, sterke klantrelaties opgebouwd en innovatieve oplossingen geleverd.




De Rol

Als Machine Learning Engineer zul je:

Samenwerken met klanten om hun behoeften te begrijpen en op maat gemaakte datasolutions te leveren.
Aan de slag gaan met het in productie brengen van modellen en end-to-end projecten.
Bouwen van data platforms en data infrastructure.
Samenwerken met een team van experts en deelnemen aan kennisdelingssessies elke vrijdag.




Ervaring

4+ jaar ervaring in data science, met een focus op voorspellende modellering en forecasting.
Vaardigheid in Python, PyTorch, Keras en Databricks.
Nederlands sprekend




Benefits

Een ondersteunende en collaboratieve werkomgeving.
Regelmatige kennisdelingssessies elke vrijdag.
Sociale evenementen om teamverbindingen te versterken.
Competitieve reisvoordelen.
Mogelijkheid om te werken met een gerenommeerd merk en een sterke klantenbasis.
Hybride werkbeleid met 2-3 dagen op kantoor en flexibiliteit op basis van projectvereisten.
Een competitief salarispakket (inclusief Bonus)




Klaar om spannende uitdagingen aan te gaan en te werken met een divers klantenbestand? Solliciteer via de knop op deze pagina en stuur je CV naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My Client are seeking a skilled and innovative Data Scientist with a strong background in Bioinformatics to join the research and development team. As a key member of our bioinformatics group, you will leverage data science techniques, machine learning, and computational biology tools to analyze complex biological datasets.







Key Responsibilities:




Analyze large-scale biological datasets, including genomic, transcriptomic, proteomic, and epigenomic data, using advanced data science methods.
Develop and apply machine learning algorithms to uncover patterns, make predictions, and extract biological insights from omics data.
Build, maintain, and optimize computational pipelines for processing, analyzing, and visualizing biological data.
Collaborate with biologists and researchers to formulate biological questions and translate them into data science problems.
Design and conduct statistical analyses to support biological hypothesis testing and validation.
Create and deploy custom bioinformatics solutions, including software tools and data models, to enable data-driven decision-making.







Qualifications:




PhD or Master’s degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in applying data science techniques to biological datasets, including experience with large-scale genomic, transcriptomic, or proteomic data.
Strong proficiency in Python, R, or similar programming languages commonly used in bioinformatics and data analysis.
Expertise in statistical modeling, machine learning, and/or artificial intelligence techniques applied to biological data.
Familiarity with bioinformatics tools and databases such as BLAST, GATK, Bioconductor, NCBI, ENSEMBL, and UCSC Genome Browser.







Salary Package:

Up to €90,000 per annum
Hybrid Working
Travel allowance

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Ben jij gepassioneerd over het verleggen van de grenzen van machine learning? Heb jij ervaring in cloudplatformen, zoals Azure. Deze klant is op zoek naar getalenteerde individuen die hun dynamische en groeiende team komt te versterken.




Over de functie

Bij deze organisatie speel je een cruciale rol in het succesvol integreren van onze machine learning-toepassingen in productiesoftware. Daarnaast draag je bij aan het bevorderen van de onderzoeksbasis, het ontwikkelen van toekomstige prototypes en het verbeteren van de continue integratieprocessen




Wat ga je doen?

Ontwerpen en implementeren van schaalbare, gedistribueerde machine learning-systemen op cloudplatforms (momenteel Azure).
Beheren van cloudgebaseerde implementaties voor machine learning-toepassingen, inclusief het monitoren van hun gezondheid en het optimaliseren van prestaties.
Zorgen voor de betrouwbaarheid, beveiliging en efficiëntie van onze machine learning-oplossingen in de cloudomgeving.
Samenwerken met cross-functionele teams om cloudservices te integreren in ons software-ecosysteem.
Helpen bij het verder automatiseren van ons continue integratieproces voor kwaliteitsborging en het identificeren van potentiële problemen.
Het team versterken door mentoring en het demonstreren van de overgang naar een cloud-first infrastructuur en het bevorderen van best practices in systeemontwerp.
Debuggen, testen en oplossen van technische problemen met betrekking tot de machine learning-toepassing.







Over de organisatie

Onze klant is een toonaangevend bedrijf op het gebied van voorraadbeheer en optimalisatie. Zij stellen hun klanten in staat om weloverwogen beslissingen te nemen door gebruik te maken van automatisering, data-inzichten en geavanceerde modelleringstechnieken. Naast de continue ontwikkeling hanteren ze state-of-the-art data science en machine learning-methodologieën om te integreren en te werken aan een volledig geautomatiseerde supply chain.







Wie ben jij

Uitgebreide ervaring met cloudplatforms, bij voorkeur Azure.
Inzicht in cloudarchitectuur, gedistribueerde systemen, beveiligingspraktijken en gerelateerde kostenbeheer.
Ervaring met het implementeren en beheren van machine learning-toepassingen in een cloudomgeving.
Ervaring met automatisering (tools zoals command-line scripting, Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, GitHub Actions, etc.).
Vertrouwd met MLOps en CI/CD-pijplijnen.
Minimaal 4 jaar relevante ervaring.
Ervaren Python-gebruiker.
Interesse in supply chain en voorraadbeheer.
Goede schrijf- en verbale vaardigheden.
Een teamspeler en leergierig.
Een hands-on mentaliteit.







Wat bieden we je

Salaris tot €71.000 per jaar (40 uur)
Flexibel werkbeleid. Mogelijkheid om vier dagen in de week thuis te werken
Werken in een diverse Artificial Intelligence team
Uitstekend pakket aan secundaire voorwaarden
Persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling in een groeiend bedrijf
Werken in een leuke, informele en internationale werkomgeving
Veel vrijheid en ruimte op eigen ideeën te implementeren







Interesse?

Herken jij jezelf in deze beschrijving en ben je klaar voor de volgende stap in je carrière? Neem dan contact op met Tim




t.brillenburg@elevationpartners.nl




Stuur je een recent CV mee, zodat we direct kunnen zien of jouw ervaring past bij het profiel.
