Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
As a senior MLOps engineer, you will be working with the platform team as well as the Data science team. You will translate the technical needs of the Data science team to appropriate templates that fit within our generalized platform. Moreover, you will consult the Platform team on best practices when it comes to MLOps and its implementation. With each other Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. With a team of 7 data scientists, machine learning engineers, and cloud engineers you shape the way we do business within the organization. As a team, we leverage data through advanced analytics to deliver data-driven tools to our stakeholders in the specific business domain. Our data science products facilitate evidence-based agile strategic and tactical decision-making. In the past the team worked on: * Measuring our client's sustainability level with natural language processing and web scraping algorithm; * Shaping the new Road Map for our Retention Strategy with AI algorithms and recommendations for retention campaigns; * Helping our portfolio management team to make the best strategic decisions based on a portfolio simulation tool or forecasting future portfolio inflow; * Helping on setting acceptance strategy for new applications based on a simulation tool powered by AI evolution strategy algorithm.With your skills and responsibilities Responsibilities for AI Models (MARS, Gen AI & New use cases): * IT Security & Compliance: Implement security concerns related to ML systems based on Rabobank standards that have been designed with close collaboration with the Solution architect and IT teams; * Templates: Create and manage reusable deployment templates for ML models; * Support Deployments: Collaborate with data scientists during model deployment; * Maintenance: Maintain ML models in production (i.e. retraining, monitoring health and ensuring service availability); * CI/CD Implementation & Orchestration: Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines and streamline deployment workflows; * Responsible for batch, real-time and GenAI model deployments; * Tech Stack Alignment: Provide support in aligning the tech stack with architectural requirements in collaboration with Solution architects and IT4IT engineers.

Qualifications:
Technical Skills:
* DBX & Databricks & Azure Tech Stack: Proficiency in these platforms and integrations;
* Architecture Affinity: Understanding of systems architecture;
* DevOps: Experience with DevOps practices;
* Security Affinity/Basics: Awareness of security best practices;
* Python: Ability to write and maintain Python code;
* Deployment Track Record: Demonstrated success in deploying ML models to production environments, both real time and batch based.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is an innovative startup based in the heart of Amsterdam, acquired by a leading insurance company in the UK. This strategic partnership provides them with a solid financial foundation while allowing them to maintain their startup culture and agility. Nestled in the vibrant Science Park in Amsterdam, our client is expanding their team to capitalize on their recent success.




Role Overview:

Our client is on the lookout for a skilled Data Scientist to join their dynamic team. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in uncovering valuable insights from extensive datasets, contributing to smarter decision-making, risk reduction, and improved service delivery. As they integrate with their new parent company, your primary focus will be on applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building predictive systems that enhance their product offerings.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain reproducible data pipelines from raw data sources to actionable insights, utilizing literate programming narratives.
Utilize open-source software, including command-line tools, emacs, org-mode, and a Python stack (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) for robust data solutions.
Document assumptions, hypotheses, tests, and evidence within data pipelines, ensuring transparency and traceability.
Collaborate in a hybrid Agile environment with a startup mindset, contributing to innovation and excellence.




Skills and Qualifications:

Strong understanding of current machine learning techniques and algorithms.
Proficiency in Python and experience with data science libraries (numPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, D3.js, GGplot, etc.
Familiarity with RDBMSs and proficiency in SQL.
Solid scripting and programming skills, including knowledge of bash and Unix command-line tools.
If you have a PhD in a relevant field or teaching experience, this would be considered a great asset




Offered:

Competitive salary: up to €55,000
Pension scheme for financial security
€30 net gym budget for well-being
Swappfiets subscription for convenient commuting
25 days of holiday leave for work-life balance
Hybrid work environment, combining the flexibility of remote work with collaborative in-office sessions.



Join our client at this exciting juncture as they combine the agility of a startup with the stability of an established insurance company. Apply now to be a key player in their growth story!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Utrecht, Nederland

Tot 80k + benefits




-Dutch Speaking-




Ben jij een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer met een passie voor in productie brengen van models. Word lid van een dynamisch en zelforganiserend klein adviesbureau dat flexibiliteit, samenwerking en het leveren van hoogwaardige oplossingen voor predictive klanten.




Het Bedrijf

Sinds 2015 heeft ons kleine adviesbureau zich gevestigd als een gemeenschap van data-experts, sterke klantrelaties opgebouwd en innovatieve oplossingen geleverd.




De Rol

Als Machine Learning Engineer zul je:

Samenwerken met klanten om hun behoeften te begrijpen en op maat gemaakte datasolutions te leveren.
Aan de slag gaan met het in productie brengen van modellen en end-to-end projecten.
Bouwen van data platforms en data infrastructure.
Samenwerken met een team van experts en deelnemen aan kennisdelingssessies elke vrijdag.




Ervaring

4+ jaar ervaring in data science, met een focus op voorspellende modellering en forecasting.
Vaardigheid in Python, PyTorch, Keras en Databricks.
Nederlands sprekend




Benefits

Een ondersteunende en collaboratieve werkomgeving.
Regelmatige kennisdelingssessies elke vrijdag.
Sociale evenementen om teamverbindingen te versterken.
Competitieve reisvoordelen.
Mogelijkheid om te werken met een gerenommeerd merk en een sterke klantenbasis.
Hybride werkbeleid met 2-3 dagen op kantoor en flexibiliteit op basis van projectvereisten.
Een competitief salarispakket (inclusief Bonus)




Klaar om spannende uitdagingen aan te gaan en te werken met een divers klantenbestand? Solliciteer via de knop op deze pagina en stuur je CV naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

The Netherlands

Salary: Up to 80,000




Looking for an ML specialist, who is keen to work on some of the most cutting-edge projects within Ai. Join a exciting start up operating in the music industry, using Machine Learning to support customer needs and optimize business decisions.




THE COMPANY

This is a company that's aim is to build insight into business decisions across the globe, you will be joining a large Machine Learning team, working and taking ownership of large-scale projects. They are specialising in the fintech space for engineering.




THE ROLE

Machine Learning Engineer, where you will look at building software products for a number of clients: You will be responsible for the design, initial development, and evaluation of ML solutions:

You will keep up to date with emerging research and trends
You will contribute to the wider data science vision and product roadmap
Actively join in, in code reviews and architectural discussions
Work closely with the engineering teams
You will have the chance to do your own independent research, also attend conferences
Build models to drive business values
Enhance products using ML
Extract information using ML to understand what matters to employees




YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Practical experience with mentoring junior members
Experience with survey data
Experience with AWS, Tensorflow and Python Data Science stack
Also knowledge of Git, Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins
Experience building complex NLP models
Good communication skills




SALARY AND BENEFITS

Up to 80,000
Flexible working
Pension scheme
+ many more




HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Charlotte York via the apply link on this page

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We are looking for experienced AI engineers to strengthen our team!




Are you excited about the recent breakthroughs in AI? Do you have the engineering skills to design and develop data & AI solutions? Then come join us in helping companies advance their business by building the next generation of AI solutions!




At Mozaik, we believe that we are at the beginning of a new era where AI technology will transform businesses in ways that are still hard to imagine. We want to shape this revolution and specialize in helping companies explore and harness the full potential of the AI promise, offering you a front-row seat to the latest developments.




With our team’s unique mix of experience and expertise, we take a start-up approach to innovation—highly collaborative and focused on learning through building. We work closely together with our clients’ product teams to rapidly create transformative solutions that delight end-users and make a significant impact on business.




You’ll thrive at Mozaik if you:

Are a doer with a proactive attitude and a strong drive to build solutions that help companies tackle complex business problems.
Are pragmatic and have shown experience in designing and building data and AI solutions in the cloud.
Enjoy teaching and explaining technically complex problems and solutions to people who are not always technology-minded.




In the spirit of our daily work optimizing AI systems, let’s also engage in some contrastive learning to help you fine-tune your preference for this role. Mozaik is not a match if you:

Are unable to take the technical lead in developing and bringing production-grade data & AI solutions to life.
Do not enjoy to collaborate with co-located teams or lack the patience to help others adopt new technology.
Prefer a completely specified career path and are not looking for an awesome adventure at a startup.




What we offer you:

Competitive compensation
Hardware of your choice
A positive, no-nonsense, output-driven work environment
Autonomy and the opportunity to work remotely
A highly productive environment with opportunities to learn and innovate
Quarterly team get-togethers in a nice location




Currently, we only consider candidates who live in the Netherlands and do not require visa status sponsorship.




Are you interested in shortcutting the hype cycle and making an impact with the latest AI breakthroughs? We’d very much like to hear from you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
*ML Engineer*

Amsterdam

Hybrid







About

Their mission is to share their passion for music videos with the world and invite people to experience music beyond listening: to see your music. Based in Amsterdam, the comapany now reaches 100 million households across multiple territories through linear networks, interactive TV apps, and on-demand streaming services. They revolutionize the way audiences experience music videos by allowing viewers to search, like, and skip through the entire catalogue, enjoy channels curated by their team of music experts, and create their own channels using the unique Mixer feature. With a full music video catalogue from major and top independent music labels, they work every day to expand our offerings.




About the Role

They are looking for a passionate Mid+/Senior Python Engineer in the Data/ML domain to join the team. You will be responsible for the machine learning services in production, including software and service design/development, monitoring, practical MLOps, performance, and architecture. You will work closely with Data Science, Data Analytics, Backend Engineering teams, and other technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and scale new/existing data and machine learning pipelines (ETLs, feature stores, productize model training and serving), data products, and services.
Resolve problems with end-to-end ownership of machine learning and data preparation/transformation pipelines.
Assist colleagues with technical challenges.
Design, test, install, and maintain highly scalable and data-intensive systems.
Review, maintain, refactor, and extend distributed systems in production. Support other teams for usage and integration with those systems.
Maintain the technical excellence of the data, ML, and software engineering practices.
Work on shared libraries, infrastructure, and building blocks within the monorepo space.
Collaborate with the Product Manager and other stakeholders, participating in forming, prioritizing, and executing the data-intensive products backlog.




Job Requirements

Broad interest and experience within ML/Data domains.
Proven professional experience as a Software Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, or Data Engineer, working with systems and data infrastructure at scale.
Experience with crafting and building large-scale data pipelines in distributed environments with technologies such as Kafka, ClickHouse, Elastic, Cassandra, Spark/PySpark, or similar.
Experience with data streams processing tools and concepts.
Experience optimizing ML models, services, pipelines, and procedures for performance, cost, and usability.
Knowledge of main architecture models and concepts like replication, sharding, consistency, horizontal and vertical scaling, idempotency.
Experience with MLOps practices, building and deploying ML models and data pipelines.
Preferably a university degree in Software Engineering or other relevant fields or comparable work experience.
Experience with data pipeline orchestrators such as AirFlow, Kubeflow, Dagster, or similar.
Excellent analytical and communication skills.
Experience in operationalizing recommender systems is a plus.




Tech Stack:

Languages: Python 3 (Pandas, Polars, NumPy, Pydantic), Scala (cats, cats-effect, fs2)
Technologies: Kafka, ClickHouse, PostgreSQL, Redis, MongoDB, Memgraph, GCP Buckets, MLFlow, Prometheus
Tools: Bazel, Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, GCP
Platforms: GitHub, CircleCI, Ansible, Superset, Grafana, and many other mostly open-source technologies




They ensure you’re taken care of by providing you the opportunity to develop your career in a young, fast-growing, and international company. They offer a challenging work environment with a lot of autonomy, flexible working hours, and no two days being the same.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Up to €80,000

Amsterdam




THE COMPANY

A leading Media Company in Amsterdam is revolutionising how people engage with their services. Their innovative platforms reach millions of households globally. Machine Learning is at the core of the services and product, and your work will have a big impact on customer experiences and enjoyment.




THE ROLE

The company is seeking a skilled Machine Learning Engineer with a passion for best-practice software engineering. In this role, you will collaborate with the existing ML team to put machine learning services in production. Your focus will be on designing, developing, and optimizing software and services, as well as ensuring smooth operations through MLOps practices.




Some of the exciting machine learning models you’ll be working with include recommendation systems, ad optimization algorithms, and content moderation models.




You will be working with a cutting-edge, open-source tech-stack, including real-time streaming in Kafka, Distributed Computing, MonoRepo, Prometheus and more.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Developing ETL pipelines for data processing, batch predictions, and real-time model serving.
Collaborating with the Data Science team to integrate ML services with other engineering teams.
Supporting and optimizing existing machine learning services and data pipelines.
Contributing to the design and implementation of new features, continuously driving innovation.




YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

To excel in this role, you will need:

Proven experience as a Python Engineer or ML Engineer - either way, you will need excellent Python Software Engineering Skills.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and experience deploying ML models in production environments.
Experience with MLOps practices and tools (e.g., MLFlow).
Strong analytical abilities and excellent communication skills.
A degree in Software Engineering or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.




THE BENEFITS

This role offers a unique opportunity to advance your career within a dynamic and rapidly growing international company. You’ll enjoy:

A challenging work environment with significant autonomy and flexible working hours.
A supportive team culture that values kindness, professionalism, and a positive attitude.
Perks like chef-prepared lunches, rooftop BBQs, and regular team events.

Title: Data Scientist - Forecasting
Description:
Data Scientist

Harnham Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands (On-site)

Data Scientist




Amsterdam, Netherlands




Salary up to 75k + Benefits




Are you a data scientist with a passion for solving forecasting solutions? Look no further! Join this dynamic team and unlock a world of opportunities in the world of data-driven decision-making.




COMPANY




This company is a cutting-edge company at the forefront of the food and beverages. They pride themselves on innovation, customer-centricity, and data-driven excellence. With a commitment to staying ahead of the curve, we are now seeking a talented Data Scientist to join our ranks and help us tackle pricing and retail problems head-on.




THE ROLE




As a Data Scientist at this company you will play a pivotal role in shaping forecasting strategies. You will have the opportunity to:

Analyze and work with forecasting data
Utilize customer data to enhance the retail shopping experience.
Develop predictive models to forecast demand and inventory needs.
Identify trends and insights that drive informed decision-making.
Develop ideas with stakeholders across the business




THE BENEFITS




What they Offer: When you join the team, you'll enjoy:
A vibrant and inclusive work environment.
Access to cutting-edge tools and technologies.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Collaboration with a diverse and talented team of experts.
Competitive compensation and benefits packages.




YOUR SKILLS AND EXPEIRENCE:




To thrive in this role, you should have:

A degree in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and a knack for problem-solving.
Relevant experience working with machine learning and forecasting
Proficiency in data manipulation, statistical modeling, and machine learning.
Knowledge of azure
Excellent teamwork and communication skills.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Coders Connect is excited to partner with a groundbreaking company driving the energy transition in the Netherlands. This innovative organization is harnessing cutting-edge technology to optimize real assets and batteries, creating immediate impact for both customers and society at large. They’re on a mission to build a sustainable future, and we’re helping them find a confident, independent Senior Data Scientist to lead the charge.




What You'll Be Doing:

Leading and growing the Data Science function within the business.
Taking existing algorithms to the next level through innovation and cloud deployment on AWS.
Applying your expertise in Time Series analysis while working hands-on with Python, SQL, and advanced technologies such as Pytorch and Tensorflow.
Implementing data models that deliver actionable insights to drive business value and accelerate societal impact.




Requirements:

5+ years of experience in Data Science, with strong Python and SQL skills.
Expertise in Time Series analysis with a solid mathematical foundation.
Cloud deployment experience using AWS.
An independent, curious problem-solver who thrives on ownership and enjoys implementing innovative models.
While experience in the energy sector is a plus, it’s not a must.




Benefits:

Be at the heart of the energy transition, working on projects that have an immediate and tangible real-world impact.
Shape the future of the Data Science department with the freedom to implement your ideas and make a direct contribution to the company’s growth.
Join a close-knit team, working alongside a CTO, three developers, and a part-time Data Scientist, all committed to advancing technology in this rapidly growing sector.
Hybrid work environment in the vibrant city of Utrecht.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Your Tasks



You find opportunities where data science can directly impact our consumers, advertisers, or employees.
You build data products at the crossroads of data science, machine learning engineering, and AI.
You talk to other teams and dig into data to understand a problem. Then deliver a solution, often with machine learning, iterating as needed.
You plan, develop, train, document, deploy, and manage production machine learning models.
You help others at RTL and beyond understand how we use data science and AI in production and at scale.
You mentor, develop, and inspire your colleagues in the team with technical expertise and keep an eye out for improvement opportunities for the long term.



Your Profile



A master’s degree in AI, data science, statistics, or a related field.
A curious, proactive and entrepreneurial mindset.
The ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively.
The ability to build good and productive working relationships with colleagues and stakeholders.
Strong language skills in English and Python.
Located in the Netherlands and eligible for work in the Netherlands.
You have at least 2 years of work experience.



Additionally, we would love it if you have experience:



building data science products in industry.
being part of a team developing and managing production models.
mentoring other data scientists and improving data science teams.
with Docker, Databricks, and MLflow, or other MLOps systems.
in media or multimodal content.
with (open-source) software development.



We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we'd still like to learn more about you and see if you could be a great fit for this position. We're committed to considering a broad array of candidates, including those who may not meet every single requirement.

Your Team

We are a team of 7 data scientists and a data science manager looking to have one more colleague. We build data products that directly impact our consumers, advertisers, or employees. Our main focus is on developing human-in-the-loop 🤖 + 👩‍🎨 solutions that empower our creative people. Additionally, we keep it flexible and contribute in multiple ways, from producing models for forecasting, enabling personalisation, to supporting marketing with a marketing mix model. As we work on a lot of diverse challenges, a day at RTL is never the same. One day, you might work on a model to pick the most aesthetically pleasing thumbnail for Videoland. Another day, you might help with selecting what movie to show on RTL 7. A third day, you might fix a production issue for search on rtl.nl.

The data science team is part of the data unit, where you will find people with other roles, such as data engineers and data analysts. In turn, the data unit is part of the tech department.

Our data science tech stack is focused on Python (with libraries Pandas, TensorFlow, PyTorch) and we are mostly on Azure. We also use PySpark. We track our code with git, package our work in Docker, deploy using Argo CD, schedule with Airflow, and track experiments with MLflow on Databricks. For video processing, we leverage Argo Workflows on Kubernetes. Most of our data comes from Snowflake or Kafka. Elasticsearch powers our search and much more.

About Us

RTL started in 1989 as the first commercial broadcaster in the Netherlands. Our mission has not changed since then: we want to reach and inspire everyone in the Netherlands with essential stories that touch the heart and mind. RTL has five television channels (RTL 4, RTL 5, RTL 7, RTL 8 and RTL Z), streaming platform Videoland, three digital theme channels (RTL Lounge, RTL Crime, RTL Telekids), sales organization Ad Alliance and the platforms RTL.nl and RTL Weer / Buienradar. RTL Nieuws, Editie NL and RTL Z bring you 24/7 the latest news, their own journalistic research and interpretation via the broadcasts, website, app and socials. Our makers tell the stories that are relevant to the Netherlands. Personal, recognizable, close by and thanks to our tech and content experts you can view it where and when you want. We are always looking for new colleagues who bring a perspective that complements and makes us better. RTL is a subsidiary of the international RTL Group, part of Bertelsmann.


Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
What is the role about?

Bitvavo is actively expanding our Data Science team within the Compliance, Legal and Risk departments. We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist with specific expertise in these areas to join our growing team. This crucial role reinforces Bitvavo's commitment to leveraging data across regulatory and risk frameworks, enhancing our data-driven approach.

As an integral part of the data team, you will play a vital role in shaping the future of cryptocurrency trading. Your responsibilities will include generating analytical insights, building models, developing data products, improving data quality and standards for informed decision-making, and providing stakeholders with the information they need to optimise their operations. A significant focus of your role will be on building models and data products that drive strategic business decisions and operational efficiencies.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

In your capacity as a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with Data Analysts, Analytics Engineers and Data Engineers to empower various business areas with data-driven insights. Your key responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:


Conducting comprehensive data analysis and building predictive models to tackle business challenges, uncover opportunities, and streamline processes in areas such as Risk, Fraud, Financial Crime, Compliance, and Operations
Establishing and nurturing partnerships with stakeholders to promote a culture of data-centric decision-making within Bitvavo
Leading the charge in data analytics and data science projects, from the planning stage through to execution, effectively turning insights into actionable strategies
Collaborating closely with the many product and engineering teams at Bitvavo to enhance data sets and pipelines in order to make Bitvavo more data-driven
Enabling the business by developing and deploying user-friendly self-service analytical tools, making them accessible to non-technical users and promoting widespread data utilization


How will you be successful?


At least 4 years of relevant experience in a Data Scientist/Quantitative Analyst role or similar, preferably with direct involvement in the CLR domain
Academic qualifications in STEM or related disciplines (Data Science, Computer Science or Econometrics)
Expertise in data analytics using scripting languages (SQL), BI tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI)
Solid command of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Tensorflow, Keras) for building predictive models and carrying out more sophisticated analyses
Enthusiasm for contributing to a fast-paced industry within a rapidly expanding company
Ability to simplify complex technical outcomes into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work across departments and with a wide range of stakeholders, bridging tech, product, and business needs to drive unified solutions


Bitvavo does not accept resumes from staffing, search, or recruitment firms without a signed agreement. If you send us a resume without such an agreement, we may contact the candidate directly without any obligation whatsoever and no fee of any kind will be paid should we hire the candidate.

Benefits

We care about our people. That's why we have a broad range of benefits to support them mentally, physically, and in their career growth. And an extra holiday for your birthday, just for fun.


Flexible well-being budget
Training and development budget
Competitive package
Hybrid working
Pension scheme
26 days holiday leave
Internet allowance
Mental health support platform
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
About AkzoNobel

Since 1792, we’ve been supplying the innovative paints and coatings that help to color people’s lives and protect what matters most. Our world class portfolio of brands – including Dulux, International, Sikkens and Interpon – is trusted by customers around the globe. We’re active in more than 150 countries and use our expertise to sustain and enhance the fabric of everyday life. Because we believe every surface is an opportunity. It’s what you’d expect from a pioneering and long-established paints company that’s dedicated to providing sustainable solutions and preserving the best of what we have today – while creating an even better tomorrow. Let’s paint the future together.

For more information please visit www.akzonobel.com

© 2024 Akzo Nobel N.V. All rights reserved.

Let's paint a picture of the role

The Data Scientist supports Internal Audit in its strategy to transform into a data driven function and reports into to Senior Audit manager in charge of Data & Analytics. The data scientist enables value-added insights via development and execution of data analytics and data visualizations to support the global internal audit function.

The Data Scientist role is expected to also join some audits as auditor, to experience how audits are performed and to help identifying improvement areas in utilizing data.

Responsibilities

  • Supports internal audit in identifying risk areas, planning, audits and review of controls testing using different Data Analytical tools and techniques;
  • Translates requirements from Internal audit in obtaining an understanding of business data and translate into useable analytics/insights;
  • Obtains the necessary data (and tools) to identify, design and develop insights;
  • Designs and develops advanced risk analytics to support (annual) audit plan;
  • Provide central, independent, common and easy access to key data for audit work;
  • Building strong relationships with stakeholders to support our data access and analytical capability to meet current and future requirements.
  • Supports the wider development and deployment of Data Analysis skills and competencies within AkzoNobel Internal Audit Function;
  • Provide internal audit staff training in use of data analytics tools / developments / techniques;
  • Update audit staff on new developments.

What do you need to have to be successful in this role?

Education

Bachelor or master’s degree preferably in computer science, information technology, artificial intelligence, accounting, auditing, economic or business administration. Experience in audit profession is preferred.

Experience

  • At least 5 years of data analytics experience ideally with experience in public accounting and/or in a large internal audit function and/or large or mid-sized international manufacturing company;
  • Understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation and excellent pattern recognition and predictive modeling skills;
  • Experience with data processing, database programming, data analytics and visualization tools (such as… ETL, SQL, Alteryx, IDEA, MS Power BI, Celonis, Databricks, MS Fabric…..).

Essential Skills

  • Professional skepticism, critical thinking, problem solving, analytic;
  • Analytical mindset, at ease with numbers and structured;
  • Sensitive to deadlines and budget constraints;
  • Effective time management skills;
  • Detail oriented;
  • Experience and able to work with different cultures, management styles;
  • Excellent communicator (presentation and communication skills);

What does AkzoNobel offer in return?

  • Above average number of annual holidays: 46 days.
  • Participation in the AkzoNobel pension plan.
  • Fixed bonus (CLA).
  • Travel expenses to and from work.
  • Opportunities for ongoing education and professional development.
  • Hybrid way of working.
  • Being part of events and networking platforms.
  • Paint with a discount.

More information on how to apply?

We welcome your online application via https://careers.akzonobel.com/ .

If you have questions about the role or interview process, please contact Berber Wegener at Berber.wegener@akzonobel.com.

The recruitment process includes a selection of the best applications received through the system, interview rounds, and further steps. An online assessment and an employment screening are part of the selection process.

At AkzoNobel we are highly committed to ensuring an inclusive and respectful workplace where all employees can be their best self. We strive to embrace diversity in a context of tolerance. Our talent acquisition process plays an integral part in this journey, as setting the foundations for a diverse environment. For this reason we train and educate on the implications of our Unconscious Bias in order for our TA and hiring managers to be mindful of them and take corrective actions when applicable. In our organization, all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.

Requisition ID: 41099

Title: Python Data Scientist - LLM Project
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 2 - 18 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Payout: USD 10 - 22 $ per hour

Work timings which is:-primarily, overlap is required from 8 AM to 1 PM PST. The remaining 3 hours can be accommodated either before 8 AM PST or after 1 PM PST

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 6 months

Must-Have

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)

At least 2 years of relevant experience as a data scientist

2+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence

2+ years of experience working with Python programming.

Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 2 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
2+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
2+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Junior Data Scientist (Remote)
Description:
Embark on a career in data science with Kreativstorm, a leading management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and turn data into actionable insights!

Are you passionate about data and eager to uncover insights that drive business decisions? Kreativstorm is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our team. You will analyze and interpret complex datasets, develop predictive models, and collaborate with the data team to extract insights. This role offers an excellent opportunity to develop your analytical skills and make a significant impact.

Job Overview and Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Position: Full-Time


Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Pursuing or having a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Junior data scientists with a strong interest in data analysis and machine learning.
Proficiency in data science tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Your Role:


Analyze and interpret complex datasets.
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms.
Collaborate with the data team to extract insights and inform decisions.
Document and present data science findings.
Support in implementing data-driven solutions.


Benefits

Why Join Us? Kreativstorm offers a dynamic and innovative environment. You will work with a team of data experts, gaining hands-on experience in data science and machine learning. We value creativity, collaboration, and data-driven decision-making. Join us to enhance your data science skills and contribute to the success of our clients.

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data science!

Title: AI Research Scientist (all genders)
Description:
Join Our Team at Seedbox: Innovating for a Better Tomorrow

Are you ready to be part of a visionary team that's redefining the landscape of AI-driven innovation? At Seedbox, we are more than just a company; we are a dynamic force of change-makers, driven by the shared vision of our founders. Our journey began with a bold idea – to harness the untapped potential of Artificial Intelligence in transforming the German "Mittelstand," the backbone of our economy. Today, we stand as a beacon of transformation, seamlessly blending the rich heritage of corporate innovation with cutting-edge AI expertise.

Our focus is on creating AI solutions that are intuitive and seamlessly integrate with our client's business processes. Thus, our approach is deeply collaborative, from ideation to development, believing that the best results come from transparency, sharing knowledge and commitment to the highest standards. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do. By combining cutting-edge AI technologies with proven expertise in corporate innovation, we aim to drive transformation in our clients' businesses.

Our team is dedicated to exploring new frontiers, constantly improving our methodologies, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible, thus providing the most up-to-date solutions. With everything we do, we are committed to ethical obligations, security implications and sustainability.

Our goal is to ensure that AI serves humanity positively, contributing to a better tomorrow for everyone.

Tasks

Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of Artificial Intelligence? Join our innovative team as an AI Research Scientist, where you’ll play a crucial role in developing and implementing cutting-edge AI models and algorithms that drive the future of our technology.


Develop and implement innovative algorithms and models in the field of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.
Analyze and optimize existing AI models to improve performance and efficiency.
Conduct research to identify new AI technologies and evaluate their potential applications.
Collaborate closely with interdisciplinary teams to integrate AI solutions into existing systems and applications.
Prepare scientific publications and presentations to communicate research findings internally and externally.
Evaluate data sources and data quality to enhance model accuracy and reliability.
Develop prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility of new AI approaches.



Requirements


A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
At least three years of experience in developing and implementing AI models, particularly in deep learning and natural language processing.
Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages, with experience in AI frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Solid understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and machine learning algorithms.
Demonstrated ability to translate research into practical applications that enhance product capabilities.
Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to communicate fluently in both spoken and written English, with at least conversational proficiency in spoken German.



Benefits


Competitive Salary: Attractive, fair, and experience-based remuneration.
Flat Hierarchies: Encouragement of personal initiative and room for your own ideas.
Career Advancement: Dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional growth.
Flexible Remote Culture: Adaptability in work location and hours, supported by efficient remote working tools.
Professional Development: Ideal environment for both personal and professional growth, with access to training and mentorship programs.
Modern Technology: State-of-the-art Apple devices and software for efficient and enjoyable work.
Prime Location: Attractive office in central Stuttgart, easily accessible by public transport and with ample parking.
Vibrant Team Culture: Regular team events, a fun atmosphere, and humorous colleagues.
Social and Sustainable Responsibility: Engage in meaningful sustainability and community initiatives within the company.
Performance Recognition: Working alongside performance-oriented, highly motivated colleagues in an ambitious setting, with clear recognition of achievements.
Employee Recognition Programs: Implement programs that regularly recognize and reward employees for their hard work and achievements.



Imagine being part of a team that is closely involved in one of the most exciting and groundbreaking topics of our time – Artificial Intelligence. With us, you have a front-row seat and a unique opportunity to actively shape the future.

We are a company that doesn’t just talk the talk, but walks the walk. Our employees are passionate about what they do, and that passion is what sets us apart. We don’t just live for AI; we create it.

To help you reach your full potential and develop outstanding AI products with us, we provide all the necessary conditions. From cutting-edge technology to a supportive and inspiring work environment – you’ll find everything you need to achieve greatness here.

Does this sound like the perfect place for you? Then apply now and join us on our mission to make a lasting impact on the world through Artificial Intelligence.
Show more

Title: MLOps Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Join Our Team at Seedbox: Innovating for a Better Tomorrow

Are you ready to be part of a visionary team that's redefining the landscape of AI-driven innovation? At Seedbox, we are more than just a company; we are a dynamic force of change-makers, driven by the shared vision of our founders. Our journey began with a bold idea – to harness the untapped potential of Artificial Intelligence in transforming the German "Mittelstand," the backbone of our economy. Today, we stand as a beacon of transformation, seamlessly blending the rich heritage of corporate innovation with cutting-edge AI expertise.

Our focus is on creating AI solutions that are intuitive and seamlessly integrate with our client's business processes. Thus, our approach is deeply collaborative, from ideation to development, believing that the best results come from transparency, sharing knowledge and commitment to the highest standards. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do. By combining cutting-edge AI technologies with proven expertise in corporate innovation, we aim to drive transformation in our clients' businesses.

Our team is dedicated to exploring new frontiers, constantly improving our methodologies, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible, thus providing the most up-to-date solutions. With everything we do, we are committed to ethical obligations, security implications and sustainability.

Our goal is to ensure that AI serves humanity positively, contributing to a better tomorrow for everyone.

Tasks

We are looking for an experienced ML Ops Developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining robust MLOps pipelines to ensure seamless deployment and scaling of machine learning models. You will work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to integrate ML models into production environments, ensuring they are efficient, secure, and reliable. If you have a passion for automation, scalability, and optimizing ML workflows, this role is for you.


Design, build, and maintain end-to-end MLOps pipelines for seamless deployment and operation of machine learning models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML models into production, ensuring high performance and scalability.
Implement and manage Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) processes for machine learning projects.
Monitor and optimize the performance, reliability, and scalability of ML models in production environments.
Ensure best practices for versioning, traceability, and reproducibility of models and data.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to model deployment, performance, and integration.
Implement robust monitoring, logging, and alerting mechanisms for deployed models.
Maintain and enhance security, compliance, and data privacy standards within ML workflows.
Research and evaluate new tools, technologies, and practices to improve MLOps processes.



Requirements


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
At least 3 years of professional experience in MLOps, DevOps, or related fields with a focus on machine learning models.
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
Deep understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their ML services.Expertise in containerization and orchestration technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar, specifically for ML pipelines.
Proficient in using monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) to manage ML models in production.
Strong knowledge of software development best practices, including version control (Git) and collaborative development.
Excellent problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing potential issues.Strong communication and teamwork abilities, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Ability to communicate fluently in both spoken and written English.



Benefits


Competitive Salary: Attractive, fair, and experience-based remuneration.
Flat Hierarchies: Encouragement of personal initiative and room for your own ideas.
Career Advancement: Dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional growth.
Flexible Remote Culture: Adaptability in work location and hours, supported by efficient remote working tools.
Professional Development: Ideal environment for both personal and professional growth, with access to training and mentorship programs.
Modern Technology: State-of-the-art Apple devices and software for efficient and enjoyable work.
Prime Location: Attractive office in central Stuttgart, easily accessible by public transport and with ample parking.
Vibrant Team Culture: Regular team events, a fun atmosphere, and humorous colleagues.
Social and Sustainable Responsibility: Engage in meaningful sustainability and community initiatives within the company.
Performance Recognition: Working alongside performance-oriented, highly motivated colleagues in an ambitious setting, with clear recognition of achievements.
Employee Recognition Programs: Implement programs that regularly recognize and reward employees for their hard work and achievements.



Imagine being part of a team that is closely involved in one of the most exciting and groundbreaking topics of our time – Artificial Intelligence. With us, you have a front-row seat and a unique opportunity to actively shape the future.

We are a company that doesn’t just talk the talk, but walks the walk. Our employees are passionate about what they do, and that passion is what sets us apart. We don’t just live for AI; we create it.

To help you reach your full potential and develop outstanding AI products with us, we provide all the necessary conditions. From cutting-edge technology to a supportive and inspiring work environment – you’ll find everything you need to achieve greatness here.

Does this sound like the perfect place for you? Then apply now and join us on our mission to make a lasting impact on the world through Artificial Intelligence.

HTML:
Join Our Team at Seedbox: Innovating for a Better Tomorrow

Are you ready to be part of a visionary team that's redefining the landscape of AI-driven innovation? At Seedbox, we are more than just a company; we are a dynamic force of change-makers, driven by the shared vision of our founders. Our journey began with a bold idea – to harness the untapped potential of Artificial Intelligence in transforming the German "Mittelstand," the backbone of our economy. Today, we stand as a beacon of transformation, seamlessly blending the rich heritage of corporate innovation with cutting-edge AI expertise.

Our focus is on creating AI solutions that are intuitive and seamlessly integrate with our client's business processes. Thus, our approach is deeply collaborative, from ideation to development, believing that the best results come from transparency, sharing knowledge and commitment to the highest standards. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do. By combining cutting-edge AI technologies with proven expertise in corporate innovation, we aim to drive transformation in our clients' businesses.

Our team is dedicated to exploring new frontiers, constantly improving our methodologies, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible, thus providing the most up-to-date solutions. With everything we do, we are committed to ethical obligations, security implications and sustainability.

Our goal is to ensure that AI serves humanity positively, contributing to a better tomorrow for everyone.

Tasks

We are looking for an experienced ML Ops Developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining robust MLOps pipelines to ensure seamless deployment and scaling of machine learning models. You will work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to integrate ML models into production environments, ensuring they are efficient, secure, and reliable. If you have a passion for automation, scalability, and optimizing ML workflows, this role is for you.

  • Strong proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.

  • Ability to communicate fluently in both spoken and written English.


Benefits

  • Career Advancement: Dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional growth.
  • Flexible Remote Culture: Adaptability in work location and hours, supported by efficient remote working tools.
  • Professional Development: Ideal environment for both personal and professional growth, with access to training and mentorship programs.
  • Modern Technology: State-of-the-art Apple devices and software for efficient and enjoyable work.
  • Prime Location: Attractive office in central Stuttgart, easily accessible by public transport and with ample parking.
  • Vibrant Team Culture: Regular team events, a fun atmosphere, and humorous colleagues.
  • Social and Sustainable Responsibility: Engage in meaningful sustainability and community initiatives within the company.
  • Performance Recognition: Working alongside performance-oriented, highly motivated colleagues in an ambitious setting, with clear recognition of achievements.
  • Employee Recognition Programs: Implement programs that regularly recognize and reward employees for their hard work and achievements.

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
MITTELSTÄNDISCH


PRAGMATISCH
LEIDENSCHAFTLICH


ACONEXT ist Kompetenz in Technologieberatung, IT und Engineering. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an den technischen Innovationen von morgen. Mit Leidenschaft für Technik und Technologie entwickeln wir mit unseren rund 700 Mitarbeiterinnen & Mitarbeitern neue Produktgenerationen für die Automobil- und Luftfahrtindustrie. Wir sind am Markt etabliert, langfristige Projekte und Geschäftsbeziehungen zeichnen uns aus. Zu unseren Kunden gehören ausschließlich namhafte Automobilhersteller und deren Systemlieferanten im süddeutschen Raum. Von der Idee für ein Produkt bis zu seiner Serienreife machen wir Innovation planbar. Was uns im Besonderen auszeichnet: Wir glauben, dass dies nur in einem Umfeld möglich ist, das auf Vertrauen, Wertschätzung, Menschlichkeit, Leidenschaft und Offenheit basiert. Wir nennen es „passion for life cycle”.

Aufgaben


Du entwickelst Lösungen (z.B. Big Data) zur Aufbereitung strukturierter und unstrukturierter Daten (u.a. durch Datenanreicherung, Qualitätskontrolle und Datentransformation)
Die Konzeption und Umsetzung von innovativen Projekten in den Bereichen Data Mining, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, Information Retrieval, Dialogbasierte Systeme und Computerlinguistik gehört zu deinen Aufgaben
Die Operationalisierung von Data Science Modellen für den produktiven Einsatz gehört in deinen Arbeitsalltag
Auch die Analyse von Kundendaten, sowie die Unterstützung bei der Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen sowie die Konzeption und Implementierung neuer Data Science Use Cases gehört zu deinen Aufgaben
Zudem setzt du Monitorings für eine nachhaltige Modellgüte auf


Profil


Neben einem erfolgreich abgeschlossenen Studium im Bereich Informatik, Mathematik, Elektrotechnik, bringst du einen Master im Bereich Machine Learning, Data Mining, künstliche Intelligenz oder verwandte Themen mit
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung z.B. in einem der Bereiche Data Analytics/Data Science, Predictive & Advanced Analytics, Big Data, Data Mining und künstliche Intelligenz sind von Vorteil, aber kein MUSS
Durch deine Programmiererfahrung bringst du Kenntnisse in Scriptsprachen und objektorientierten Technologien, wie z.B. Java, R, Python, MapReduce, Hadoop mit
Und besitzt darüber hinaus die Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen und Szenarien zu verstehen, detailliert zu analysieren und die gewonnenen Erkenntnisse zu präsentieren
Ein hohes Maß an Teamfähigkeit, Eigeninitiative und sorgfältige Arbeitsweise gepaart mit einer offenen, kommunikativen Art runden dein Profil ab
Erfahrung mit agilen Vorgehensmethoden und Tools (SCRUM, JIRA, ...) sind ein Plus
Gute Deutsch- und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse sind für dich kein Problem


Wir bieten


Fair Pay+: Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag/ branchenüberdurchschnittliches Vergütungssystem inkl. Zusatzleistungen, z.B. Zuschüsse für KiTa, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Bonussystem
Teilhabe: Projektverantwortung & Ownership/ flache Hierarchien/ kurze Entscheidungswege/ aktive Mitwirkung an spannenden Projekten
Weiterentwicklung: Persönliches & intensives Onboarding/ individuelle Weiterbildungs- & Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten inkl. Coaching- & Mentoring-Programm
Flexibilität: Hybrides & agiles Arbeiten (Homeoffice, mobile work), Arbeitszeiten & -ort individuell plan- und umsetzbar/ 30 Tage Urlaub/ Fokus auf Work-Life-Balance
Extras: Fitness & Wellbeing, Zugang zum firmeneigenen Fahrzeugpool & vielfältige Mitarbeiterrabatte
Zusammenhalt: Regelmäßige Teamevents & Feste/ familiäres Betriebsklima mit Fokus auf Kollegialität, Teamgeist & Mitarbeiterzufriedenheit
Gelebte Vielfalt: Bunte Unternehmenskultur/ Altersmix, Frauen in Führungspositionen & internationale Kolleginnen und Kollegen


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Herausforderung

Du begeisterst dich für ML und AI und willst mit uns gemeinsam die AI unserer Kunden gestalten? Du hast Spaß daran, in einem agilen Umfeld Akzente zu setzen und AI-Use-Cases für unsere Kunden produktive Realität werden zu lassen? Use Cases, bei denen sie nicht nur staunen, sondern die ihre Produktivität wirklich steigern? Du redest nicht nur über datengetriebenes Arbeiten, sondern lebst es jeden Tag vor? - Dann passt du zu uns!

Was dich erwartet


Arbeit im Team mit Data Scientists, Data Engineers und Platform Engineers
Beratung unserer Kunden bei Data Science, AI- und Analytics-Projekten
Unterstützung unserer Kunden beim Design und Aufbau ihrer Data Science- und AI Plattformen
Implementierung von AI und Machine Learning Services in die IT-Architekturen unserer Kunden
Management von Modellen mit MLOps-Tools und Frameworks
Durchführung von Workshops und Schulungen, wie z.B. Requirements-Workshops, Toolschulungen, etc.
Unterstützung bei Vertriebsaktivitäten, wie z.B. Kundenpräsentationen, PoCs, der Erstellung von Angeboten etc.


Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit IT-Bezug, in Mathematik, Physik oder Statistik
Leidenschaft für Daten und praktische Erfahrung in AI und Softwareentwicklung, bevorzugt in den Bereichen Natural Language Processing und Deep Learning
Du bringst mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im produktiven Roll-Out von Enterprise-Scale AI, ML und LLM-Lösungen mit
Ebenso hast du Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Projekten mit Frameworks wie TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Pandas oder ähnlichen
MLOps ist für dich kein Fremdwort, sondern gelebte Realität
Python und SQL sprichst du genauso sicher wie Englisch und Deutsch - in diesen Sprachen kommunizierst du auch komplexe technische Konzepte adressatengerecht
Du hast den Willen und die Fähigkeit, die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden zu Erfolgen werden zu lassen


Interessiert?

Wir freuen uns über deine Bewerbung (PDF) mit Angabe des Gehaltswunsches und möglichem Eintrittstermin. Jetzt online in unter 4 Minuten bewerben!
Show more

Dein Profil

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium mit IT-Bezug, in Mathematik, Physik oder Statistik
  • Leidenschaft für Daten und praktische Erfahrung in AI und Softwareentwicklung, bevorzugt in den Bereichen Natural Language Processing und Deep Learning
  • Du bringst mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im produktiven Roll-Out von Enterprise-Scale AI, ML und LLM-Lösungen mit
  • Ebenso hast du Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Projekten mit Frameworks wie TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Pandas oder ähnlichen
  • MLOps ist für dich kein Fremdwort, sondern gelebte Realität
  • Python und SQL sprichst du genauso sicher wie Englisch und Deutsch - in diesen Sprachen kommunizierst du auch komplexe technische Konzepte adressatengerecht
  • Du hast den Willen und die Fähigkeit, die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden zu Erfolgen werden zu lassen

Interessiert?

Wir freuen uns über deine Bewerbung (PDF) mit Angabe des Gehaltswunsches und möglichem Eintrittstermin. Jetzt online in unter 4 Minuten bewerben!

Title: ML & Data Engineer for Edge & Hybrid Cloud for Digital Twin (f/m/div.)
Description:
Company Description

At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Welcome to Bosch.

The grow platform GmbH is looking forward to your application!

Job Description

We make machines speak! Find out how by becoming one of our team members in Bosch’s Home of Intrapreneurs. “Bosch Digital Twin Industries” is a corporate start-up that is going global and faces huge business potential which now needs to be realized. Therefore, we need you as contributors, shapers & fellow team members in a multi-cultural, innovative and ambitious environment. Together we will take human and machine intelligence to a next level of human-machine collaboration based on learning algorithms & real-world challenges with large industrial machinery.

As an ML & Data Engineer for Bosch Digital Twin Industries (BDTI), you will be responsible for developing and implementing our digital twin solution for edge & hybrid cloud setups. This involves implementing ML & data engineering pipelines using state-of-the-art frameworks / databases and deploying them in a container-based manner using Docker / Kubernetes.


Container-Based Solutions: Design and explore IoT and cloud solutions using Docker / Kubernetes for edge-based machine learning use cases.
Data Flow Streamlining: Streamline data flow pipelines including data ingestion, storaging, deploying ML models, interfacing with cloud, connecting to backend / frontend; including the selection of ideal software technologies, databases and relevant frameworks (e.g. databases, orchestration, MLOps tools).
Cloud-Agnostic Software Solutions: Develop cloud-agnostic software solutions that can be deployed on any hardware or cloud environment with minimal modifications.
MLOps Concept Development: Develop and implement a MLOps concept tailored for digital twin solutions.


Qualifications


Education: Master's degree in computer science, data science, or a related field.
Experience and Know-How: Minimum of 3 years of experience in machine learning algorithms and frameworks, with a focus on scalable infrastructure and automation for deploying and managing ML models in production environments.
Technical Proficiency: Python, skills in relevant ML & data engineering tools / frameworks (e.g. MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow, MongoDB, time-series databases). Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift) and cloud platforms (AWS/Azure) is preferred.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with an ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Problem-solving: Strong analytical skills with a focus on delivering business value through efficient and reliable ML operations.
Languages: You are business fluent in English, other languages are welcome.


Additional Information

The contractual work location is Ludwigsburg.

You want to work remotely or part-time - we offer great opportunities for mobile working as well as different part-time models. Feel free to contact us.

Diversity and inclusion are not just trends for us but are firmly anchored in our corporate culture. Therefore, we welcome all applications, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, ethnic origin or sexual identity.

Here you get more information about Digital Twin: Digital Twin | Bosch Global Software Technologies PVT LTD (bosch-softwaretechnologies.com)

Digital Twin is a trend-setting business model innovation financed by the grow platform GmbH, the Bosch incubator platform. Get more information here: What's in it for you? | grow platform

Title: Junior Software Developer (m/w/d)
Description:
NOVENTI ist der führende Anbieter von Software, Finanzdienstleistungen und digitalen Plattformen im europäischen Gesundheitsmarkt. Das Angebot richtet sich an alle Leistungserbringer des Gesundheitswesens, wie z.B. Apotheken, Physiotherapie, Sanitätshäuser, Pflegedienste und Arztpraxen. Wir begleiten unsere Kundinnen und Kunden in digitalen Transformationsprozessen wie dem eRezept, bieten hybride Lösungen und vernetzen sowohl die Dienstleister im Gesundheitsmarkt als auch die Menschen miteinander. Gegründet vor über 120 Jahren umfasst das Unternehmen mit Hauptsitz in München heute über 1.900 Mitarbeitende.

Junior Software Developer (m/w/d)

Bietigheim-Bissingen, Mannheim, München, mit Homeoffice-Anteil

Als führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Gesundheits-IT suchen wir einen (Junior) Software Developer (m/w/d) der dabei unterstützt, unsere innovativen Softwarelösungen weiterzuentwickeln und die Digitalisierung im Gesundheits­wesen voranzutreiben. Als Unternehmen, das sich der digitalen Transformation verschrieben hat, sind wir auf der Suche nach Mitarbeitenden, um gemeinsam das Tagesgeschäft unserer Kunden zu erleichtern und das Unternehmen voranzubringen.

Aufgaben


Du bist verantwortlich für das Konzipieren und Durchführen der Programmerstellung entsprechend der Arbeitspakete, unter Einhaltung der Coding- und Architektur-Richtlinien.
Zu Deinem Aufgabenfeld gehört die Definition, das Design, die Erstellung und Durchführung automatisierter Testszenarien und Testfällen auf unterschiedlichen Teststufen.
Ebenfalls zu Deinem Aufgabenfeld gehört das Durchführen von Fehlerbehebungen.
Zusätzlich verantwortest Du die Erstellung von Programmdokumentationen und unterstützt außerdem bei der Erstellung der Anwenderdokumentation sowie bei Maßnahmen des Rollouts.
Das Abwickeln von Rollouts der erstellten Programme und Applikationen sowie das Überwachen und Betreuen der Programme und Applikationen im Betrieb runden Dein Aufgabenprofil ab.


Profil


Du hast ein Hochschulstudium im Bereich der Informationstechnik abgeschlossen oder verfügst über eine vergleichbare Qualifikation wie bspw. eine Ausbildung im Bereich der Fachinformatik.
Kenntnisse in Projekt-, Anforderungs-, Änderungs- und Konfigurationsmanagement gehören zu Deinem Erfahrungs­schatz.
Idealerweise verfügst Du über Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung von Softwareprodukten, Methoden und Werkzeugen (bspw. SCRUM, Kanban).
Praxiserfahrung im Bereich der Programmiersprachen sowie Kenntnisse von modernen, objektorientierten Program­mier­sprachen runden Dein Profil ab.
Darüber hinaus verfügst Du über gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie über ausgeprägte kommunikative und analytische Fähigkeiten.
Eine teamorientierte, systematische und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise ist für dich selbstverständlich.


Wir bieten


Altersversorgung Speziell auf unsere Branche zugeschnittene Konzepte und attraktive Zuschüsse
EGYM WELLPASS Vergünstigte Mitgliedschaft für Bewegung, Ausgleich und Gesundheit
HASI-Tag Um die Feiertage in vollen Zügen zu genießen, ist an Heiligabend und Silvester frei
Brauchtumstag Einen individuell planbaren Brauchtumstag als zusätzlichen freien Tag
Firmenfahrrad Fahrradleasing eines hochwertigen (E-)Bikes mit Steuervorteil
Workcation 15 Tage pro Jahr mobiles Arbeiten im europäischen Ausland


Wir Stehen Für Folgende Werte

Kollaboration: Wir arbeiten zusammen und finden gemeinsam Lösungen, um unsere Unternehmensziele zu erreichen.

Innovation: Wir schauen über den Tellerrand hinaus, schaffen kreative Freiräume und haben Mut, Neues auszuprobieren.

Transparenz: Wir kommunizieren klar und offen und lassen Worten stets Taten folgen.

Kundenfokus: Wir handeln in allen Bereichen und auf allen Ebenen serviceorientiert, zum Wohle unserer Kundinnen und Kunden.

Dynamik: Wir handeln proaktiv und leben verständliche Prozesse.

Unternehmertum: Wir übernehmen Verantwortung auf allen Ebenen und treffen wirtschaftliche Entscheidungen mit dem Ziel, die NOVENTI Gruppe zu stärken.

Wertschätzung: Wir haben Vertrauen ineinander, gehen respektvoll miteinander um und geben konstruktives Feedback.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

  • Brauchtumstag Einen individuell planbaren Brauchtumstag als zusätzlichen freien Tag
  • Firmenfahrrad Fahrradleasing eines hochwertigen (E-)Bikes mit Steuervorteil
  • Workcation 15 Tage pro Jahr mobiles Arbeiten im europäischen Ausland

Title: Python Backend Developer - Remote
Description:
Location: Latin America/Europe - Permanent Remote

Experience: 6 - 15 Years

Role Type: Contracting Full Time (40 Hrs/week)

Overlap Hours: 8 Hours PST time

Contract Duration: 3-6 Months

Mandatory Skills

Python- 5 years,

Django- 5 years,

SQL-5 years.

Hands-on experience with the AWS cloud is mandatory

Total years of exp- 6+ years experience mandatory

Required Skills


7+ years of experience in software development - ( Purely backend )
Coding experience in server-side programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, Ruby) as well as database languages (SQL)
Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)
Past experience and success in building and supporting scalable APIs, services, or applications
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


About The Role

A globally recognised firm is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join their Carriers team! The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, he/she will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for their team and the Engineering team.

Responsibility

Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs that can handle millions of requests a day.


Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns from the data model, queuing of jobs, application layering and container-based software distribution.
Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
Participate in peer reviews, testing and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics to ensure performance and quality.
Work with a sense of urgency and iterate quickly in an agile process.
Mentor more junior engineers on engineering best practices.
Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges and translate those into technical solutions.
