Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

Data Scientist for Marketing at Saxo Bank 

Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive impactful marketing strategies? Saxo Bank is on an exhilarating journey to become a data-driven organization, and we are seeking a dynamic Data Scientist to take the lead of the development of our predictive models focused on marketing. If you are eager to make a significant impact and grow with us, this is the perfect opportunity for you. 

Predictive Modelling and AI 

As our new Data Scientist, you will be an integral part of our Predictive Modelling and AI team. You will collaborate closely with our Marketing and Digital Analytics teams, as well as other data scientists and data engineers. Your role will involve building data pipelines using Airflow and Databricks, publishing data to Kafka and Data Lake, and deploying machine learning APIs to Kubernetes, primarily using Python. 

The Job

Below are examples of what you can be responsible for:


Evaluate marketing performance (return on marketing spend) by combining Saxo data with 3rd party data.
Further develop our lead value score models. The models are used both by sales and marketing to maximize business outcomes.
Assist in the development of marketing data foundation and establish data flows from marketing engines
Develop an attribution model (MMM) for marketing and the rest of the organization to assist optimizing spend across markets and channels.
Correlation and causality analysis on channels and campaigns.


YOUR PROFILE

Your colleagues and friends describe you as methodical, curious, self-motivated and with a logical mindset.

We expect you to be proficient in python or R and further recognize yourself in the below bullets:


Relevant education or professional experience in Science, Technology, Economics, or Mathematics.
Experience with time series analysis and state space modelling.
Prior experience working with Marketing.
Knowledge of database systems: Efficient in SQL (knowledge of Azure Data Lake, Databricks Delta Lake is a plus).
ETL skills (knowledge of Apache Airflow, Spark/Databricks, and Kafka).
Experience with Git.
Ability to present data in an understandable way (knowledge of PowerBI or similar is a plus).
Verbal and written English.


Kindly note this position is located in our HQ in Denmark.

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!
Show more

We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Acceleration
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Acceleration søger en Junior Data Scientist, der brænder for at transformere data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Kan du lide at arbejde i Excel og Python eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig vi leder efter. Vi søger en studerende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Acceleration er en del af GroupM, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Acceleration er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geogratiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et højt respekteret team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Acceleration

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne kontinuerligt bliver større og mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, samtidig med at du lærer en masse om branchen og metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle din færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik.
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office pakken (PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python og enten har erfaring med eller nysgerrig på at arbejde med Cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser.
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines.
Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger.


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et fantastisk engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi senest har været i Warszawa.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktiv. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en af del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor er beliggende på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@groupm.com
Show more

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@groupm.com

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist/ Analyst – Claims Analytics

Brænder du for analyse og data? Vil du bidrage til at gøre Gjensidige endnu mere indsigtsdrevet? Vi skal styrke vores analysekapacitet, så nu har du muligheden!

Gode grunde til at arbejde i Gjensidige

I Gjensidige har vi arbejdet for at sikre liv, sundhed og værdier i over 200 år. Vi har som ambition at være Nordens mest kundeorienterede skadeforsikringsselskab, og koncernens strategi er at være indsigt- og analysebaseret. Vi ønsker at forstærke indsatsen og søger efter en engageret og dygtig Data Scientist/ Analytiker.

Division Skade skal levere markedets bedste kundeoplevelser, når skaden har sket. Vi har satset stort på ny teknologi og automatisering de sidste år, og har ambitiøse mål for fortsat effektivisering og teknologiudvikling. Teamet i Claims Analytics vil være helt centralt i dette arbejde. Afdelingen består af 10 dygtige medarbejdere, 8 i Norge og 2 i Danmark. Vi ønsker nu at udvide teamet i Danmark med en tredje Data Scientist/ Analytiker. Vi arbejder sammen på tværs for at gøre Skade endnu mere analyse- og indsigtsdrevet, og udnytte nye muligheder inden for eksempelvis AI-teknologi. I rollen som Data Scientist/ Analyst kan du gøre en forskel i dette arbejde. Hos os vil du arbejde med spændende og udfordrende opgaver.

Din hverdag som Data Scientist/ Analyst i Claims Analytics vil blandt andet bestå af:


Bidrage til at opnå koncernens ambitiøse mål for at reducere erstatningsomkostninger, bæredygtige og effektive skadeprocesser samt markedets bedste kundeoplevelser drevet af AI, data og Analytics
Udvikle gode styringsværktøjer for skadeorganisationen
Overvåge, analysere og formidle indsigt knyttet til drift, erstatningsomkostninger og udvikling
Rapportering og prognoser
Udforske og anvende AI, machine learning, osv. indenfor for eksempel fraud, tekst- og billedanalyse, m.m.



Vi forestiller os at du har:


En relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau inden for f.eks. statistik, matematik, økonomi, IT eller lignende
Erfaring med programmering og analyseværktøjer (for eksempel SAS/ SQL/ Python/ Power BI/ dbt /Databricks)
Erfaring inden for forsikring
Omgængelig, trives med at formidle indsigt og kommunikerer godt på et skandinavisk sprog og engelsk (mundtligt og skriftligt)
Forretningsorienteret og relationsskabende både indenfor og udenfor teamet
Nysgerrig og kan lide at udforske potentialet i komplekse og store mængder data fra flere forskellige kilder
Gåpåmod og er vedholdende
Tager initiativ, kan lide et højt tempo, er selvmotiverende og samtidig en holdspiller



Hvad kan vi tilbyde

Du kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med en samling af drevne, fagligt dygtige og søde kollegaer i både Danmark og Norge. Gjensidige er et af Nordens største forsikringsselskaber, så der er mange muligheder for både faglig og personlig udvikling – på tværs af fag og landegrænser. Du får gode vilkår, fordelagtige forsikringer og pensionsordninger og - hvis vi selv skal sige det - et hav af gode kollegaer. Derudover får du en arbejdsplads placeret centralt i København, i moderne omgivelser tæt på vandet med nem adgang til offentlig transport og gode parkeringsmuligheder.

Er du interesseret?

Så send os din ansøgning og CV snarest muligt og senest den 29.09.2024. Ansøgninger vurderes løbende.

Ønsker du yderligere oplysninger kan du kontakte Leder Claims Analytics, Katharina H. Hesbø Belbo på +47 99 36 28 04 for at høre mere om jobbet, og hvordan det er at være medarbejder hos os i Gjensidige.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!
Show more

Ønsker du yderligere oplysninger kan du kontakte Leder Claims Analytics, Katharina H. Hesbø Belbo på +47 99 36 28 04 for at høre mere om jobbet, og hvordan det er at være medarbejder hos os i Gjensidige.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Internship: Data Scientist
Description:
Internship:
Data Scientist

Dreaming of working with high-quality software that makes a real difference? Then seize this opportunity and apply for an internship as a Data Scientist at Systematic!

More than just an internship
As a Data Scientist intern, you will join our SitaWare Insight team which is part of our Defence business unit. SitaWare Insight is a decision-support tool that transforms data collection and management, providing commanders at various levels with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities. The mission for the program is to simplify critical decision-making. Modern technologies like AI are used to transform data into information, providing commanders with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities.

As an intern, you will play a vital role in the team, contribute to the advancement of modern technologies and be treated on a par with the other employees. Moreover, you will become an integrated part of a team from day one, receiving the professional sparring and feedback you need to succeed.

Freedom With Responsibilities
Our new intern will get to make a real difference working with high-quality software, while you will have every opportunity to apply what you have learnt so far on your study programme. In addition, some of your daily tasks include contributing to daily advancements and developing and documenting code according to agile principles while using Python and other relevant technologies.

In so far as possible, you will be able to plan your own tasks as we strive to create the right balance between your personal wishes, your formal study requirements and our expectations.

You are our new intern
… if you are studying for a BSc or MSc in Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Engineering or similar. And if you work systematically, are motivated by the quality of your work and always maintain a focus on the details.

Throughout your internship, the focus will be on developing your competencies, which we envisage are as follows:


You take an interest in, are knowledgeable about or have experience with LLMs and natural language processing methods.
You possess experience at developing or implementing machine learning models.
You are proficient with Python and popular ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Transformers or TensorFlow.
You are proficient in data preprocessing and feature engineering.
You understand data handling, model evaluation, the visualisation of data-driven solutions and the development of best practices.
You speak and write English fluently as it is our corporate language. It is also an advantage if you can speak Danish, but this is not a requirement. 



Practical information  

The internship lasts five months, starting 3 February 2025. 
The internship is a full-time position.
When applying, please include your CV as well as your exam certificates. 
We will be assessing job applications as we receive them, as we are keen to fill the position as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!  



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.  

  

Never stop developing   

Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.   

 

In addition to your team, you will become part of an Intern network with other Interns at Systematic, providing you with a rich opportunity to network across the organisation. You can also look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 social/professional events a year. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!  

  

Start your development here  

We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Helene Overgaard Bach, Junior Consultant, People Attraction.

Get in touch

Helene Overgaard Bach

Junior Consultant
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
My client is a leader in the maritime industry.




Role: Data Scientist




Location: Remote (Must have eligibility to work in Denmark)




Overview




You will be working in a dynamic team with other data scientists in driving impactful insights and solutions through advanced analytics and machine learning techniques. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the direction of our data science initiatives and driving innovation.




Education




Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field




Ideal candidate

Strong understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and libraries.
Ideally also AI LLM experience
3 years experience in machine learning and statistical modeling.
2 years work or research experience in discrete optimization / operation research.
Experience with production systems (not pure research)
Experience in the role of team lead building successful (web) applications in an agile environment.
Have a solid background in Data/Computer Science and/or Statistics/ Econometrics/ Mathematics .
Proficient in programming languages such as Python and SQL. Experience with Pandas and FastApi
Strong understanding of machine learning techniques, algorithms
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib.




Advantage

Maritime or SAS experience preferred, other industries considered




*** Only successful candidate will be contacted ***

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Acceleration
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Acceleration søger en Junior Data Scientist, der brænder for at transformere data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Kan du lide at arbejde i Excel og Python eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig vi leder efter. Vi søger en studerende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Acceleration er en del af GroupM, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Acceleration er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geogratiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et højt respekteret team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Acceleration

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne kontinuerligt bliver større og mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, samtidig med at du lærer en masse om branchen og metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle din færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik.
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office pakken (PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python og enten har erfaring med eller nysgerrig på at arbejde med Cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser.
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines.
Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger.


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et fantastisk engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi senest har været i Warszawa.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktiv. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en af del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor er beliggende på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@groupm.com
Show more

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@groupm.com

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.

At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.

To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.

In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks

Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines

Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.

You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.

About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.

About you


Fluency within mathematics and statistics

Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring

Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming

Proficiency with computer science fundamentals

A scientific and inquisitive mind

Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets

Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost

Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++

PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics

What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy

Exciting problems to solve

Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people

Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model

Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation

Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: Machine Learning Weather Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further. Does this sound highly appealing to you?

Then you might be our new Machine Learning (ML) Weather Researcher at Alipes Capital.




About the Role

Alipes began trading in the Energy sector in 2022. We use machine learning technology for reading and interpreting fundamental and market data and execute our trading strategies based on this data. Since our inception in 2008, we have continuously grown and diversified into new business areas driven by our technology. Alipes aims to support liquid power markets and free flow of energy, which are crucial to facilitate the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources, thereby promoting a sustainable future.




Forecasting power generation from renewables is crucial for price discovery, risk management and for balancing the power grid. Recent advances in ML/AI/Neural based weather modeling promise models which are orders of magnitude faster to run than traditional physics-based numerical weather models.




Your work as our new ML Weather Researcher will involve turning massive data sets of weather data into machine learning models that accurately predict short-term weather patterns and power production from renewables.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult. We are centrally located in Copenhagen and have 55 bright and ambitious team members.




About the Team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative analysts covering 6 nationalities – a combination of PhD’s and MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and economists that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About You

Experience with ML/AI/Neural-based weather forecasting (GraphCast etc)
Experience with Deep Learning and Neural Networks
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science or relevant field
Familiar with terms like ECMWF IFS, HRRR, GFS, GOES etc.
Proficiency within computer science fundamentals, mathematics and statistics
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
A scientific and inquisitive mind




What we can Offer You

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: Lead Data and AI Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to research and build advanced analytics solutions using the latest tech? Are you looking to have a global impact by producing state-of-the-art advanced analytics solutions? Join our Advanced Analytics & AI team to help improve and grow our data science portfolio - and become one of the leading minds behind the future setup for advanced analytics. You will help empower business units to make data-driven decisions and even automate operations.

Join our Data & AI tech hub in Copenhagen

We lead data science initiatives and capabilities and drive an ambitious strategy to fundamentally improve how we operate based on data. This means working with the entire value chain - from logistics and sales to marketing, pricing, and store operations.

As a Lead Data Scientist, you will develop, implement, and deliver complex solutions, ranging from exploratory analyses to automated solutions in production. Using DevOps and DataOps pipelines, you will deploy and maintain solutions, and you will:

Be a leading mind in the Data Science & Machine Learning product team, working closely with skilled ML engineers and (Sr) Data Scientists
Scope and develop new data science products, e.g., for price optimization, inventory management, marketing analytics, consumer analytics, pricing, demand sensing, etc.
Clean, prepare, and synthesize data for use in descriptive analysis, as well as predictive, prescriptive, and generative models
Develop and implement machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) algorithms for real-world problems by using supervised, unsupervised, semi-unsupervised, and reinforcement learning
Deliver solutions based on a modern data platform provided by the Data Platform team
You enjoy applying analytics to real-life business challenges

While self-driven and resourceful, you enjoy working in teams to solve challenges and develop the best solutions. With your creative can-do mindset and strong problem-solving skills, you can find opportunities for process optimization and test the effectiveness of different models and courses of action.

You are always interested in learning new technologies and ways of working - and open to unlearning old ones. Moreover, we imagine that you:

Hold a master's degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline, e.g., statistics, mathematics, engineering, or operations research
Have significant experience as a Senior Data Scientist or an equivalent quantitative role with a strong focus on statistics
Have significant experience using data science/database software and programming languages, such as SQL, R, and Python
Have experience with unified analytics engines such as Apache Spark and Databricks, as well as with container platform/orchestration systems such as Docker/Kubernetes
Are fluent in English and have solid communication skills; fluency in Danish is a plus
We tackle an endless range of new opportunities

You can look forward to joining a tech hub with highly skilled, motivated, collaborative, and fun-loving colleagues. We share an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment, explore, and innovate, we are tackling an endless range of new opportunities.

We are always ready to implement new technologies into our workflow. In addition, your continued personal and professional development is essential to us, and we offer participation in internal and external courses, education, and conferences supporting this development.


Desired Skills and Experience


Do you want to research and build advanced analytics solutions using the latest tech? Are you looking to have a global impact by producing state-of-the-art advanced analytics solutions? Join our Advanced Analytics & AI team to help improve and grow our data science portfolio - and become one of the leading minds behind the future setup for advanced analytics. You will help empower business units to make data-driven decisions and even automate operations.

Join our Data & AI tech hub in Copenhagen

As a Lead Data Scientist, you will develop, implement, and deliver complex solutions, ranging from exploratory analyses to automated solutions in production. Using DevOps and DataOps pipelines, you will deploy and maintain solutions, and you will:

Be a leading mind in the Data Science & Machine Learning product team, working closely with skilled ML engineers and (Sr) Data Scientists
Scope and develop new data science products, e.g., for price optimization, inventory management, marketing analytics, consumer analytics, pricing, demand sensing, etc.
Clean, prepare, and synthesize data for use in descriptive analysis, as well as predictive, prescriptive, and generative models
Develop and implement machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) algorithms for real-world problems by using supervised, unsupervised, semi-unsupervised, and reinforcement learning
Deliver solutions based on a modern data platform provided by the Data Platform team

With your creative can-do mindset and strong problem-solving skills, you can find opportunities for process optimization and test the effectiveness of different models and courses of action.

You are always interested in learning new technologies and ways of working - and open to unlearning old ones. Moreover, we imagine that you:

Develop and implement machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) algorithms for real-world problems by using supervised, unsupervised, semi-unsupervised, and reinforcement learning
Deliver solutions based on a modern data platform provided by the Data Platform team
You enjoy applying analytics to real-life business challenges

While self-driven and resourceful, you enjoy working in teams to solve challenges and develop the best solutions. With your creative can-do mindset and strong problem-solving skills, you can find opportunities for process optimization and test the effectiveness of different models and courses of action.

You are always interested in learning new technologies and ways of working - and open to unlearning old ones. Moreover, we imagine that you:

Hold a master's degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline, e.g., statistics, mathematics, engineering, or operations research
Have significant experience as a Senior Data Scientist or an equivalent quantitative role with a strong focus on statistics
Have significant experience using data science/database software and programming languages, such as SQL, R, and Python
Have experience with unified analytics engines such as Apache Spark and Databricks, as well as with container platform/orchestration systems such as Docker/Kubernetes
Are fluent in English and have solid communication skills; fluency in Danish is a plus
We tackle an endless range of new opportunities

You can look forward to joining a tech hub with highly skilled, motivated, collaborative, and fun-loving colleagues. We share an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment, explore, and innovate, we are tackling an endless range of new opportunities.

We are always ready to implement new technologies into our workflow. In addition, your continued personal and professional development is essential to us, and we offer participation in internal and external courses, education, and conferences supporting this development.

Darwin Recruitment is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Title: AI Researcher
Description:
Leonardo.Ai seeks a Mid-Level AI Researcher to join our expanding, global AI team.

This is an exciting opportunity for AI or Machine Learning professionals and academics to join the brightest minds, helping Australia’s most potent AI-powered platform unleash the world’s creativity through our foundational model, Phoenix.

The Role:

As a Mid-Level AI Researcher, you’ll collaborate with your team to develop and refine our Design Models, contribute to critical research initiatives, and integrate breakthroughs into our platform to enhance the user experience.

We are hiring across multiple disciplines in AI Research and welcome candidates with backgrounds in foundational model training, data exploration, systems engineering, optimisation, and applied research science.

Responsibilities:


Contribute to developing and improving AI models, focusing on areas like model training and optimisation.
Collaborate with team members to integrate research into our platform, enhancing features like generative models.
Assist in data exploration, debugging, and validation to ensure models perform as expected.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure research aligns with company goals.
Contribute to a collaborative, inclusive team environment where diversity and fair treatment are prioritised.
Stay up-to-date with emerging tools and techniques in AI, applying them to ongoing projects.


Skills We Like:


Proficiency in Python, deep learning frameworks, cloud computing, and software engineering.
Strong knowledge of natural language processing, computer vision, ML model training, and data pipeline model creation.
A team-oriented mindset with the ability to collaborate across disciplines.
Eagerness to stay updated on new advancements in the AI space.
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in AI or related field, with experience in data, ML, and AI research.
Experience with research papers or contributions to open-source AI projects is a plus.


Our Culture:


Inclusive Culture: We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and empowered. At Leonardo AI, your unique perspectives and experiences are welcomed and essential to our success.
Flexible Work Environment: We understand the importance of work-life balance. Enjoy the flexibility to work remotely or from our vibrant offices. We have employees all over Australia, ensuring you can thrive personally and professionally.
Empowering Growth: Your development is our priority. We offer continuous learning opportunities and career growth tailored to your goals. You’ll be encouraged to grow and excel in your career at Leonardo AI.
Impactful Work: Join us in shaping the future of AI. You'll work on innovative projects that have a meaningful impact, and your contributions will help drive advancements in AI creativity.


Next Steps:

If you're passionate about reading and publishing AI research papers, have a history of implementing AI models (open source/ proprietary), and are keen to be exposed to bringing models to production, this role might be the perfect fit for you.

We encourage you to apply and start the conversation whether you’re based locally in Europe or overseas.

Why Leonardo.Ai?


Shape the Future of AI: Join us in revolutionising content creation and build a platform at the forefront of generative AI, in an award winning culture.
Hybrid and Remote Options: Flexibility is key. Choose a work arrangement that suits your lifestyle and allows you to do your best work. Our hybrid team members meet in the Sydney office 1-2 times per week, with free lunch on Fridays.
Benefits: We offer a generous package including paid parental leave, home office and wellness budgets, and remote working from overseas.
Diversity and Inclusion: We intentionally seek people from a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives to join our team. We wholeheartedly believe in creating an inclusive environment where every voice we hear contributes to our success.


Typical Interview Process

While we love technology, rest assured that our interview process is all human. A Talent team member will review your application, and we'll contact you either way to let you know the outcome. Here's what you can expect.

Round 1 - Meet Your Recruiter:


Our Talent team will reach out and arrange a 30-minute video call where you'll cover your experience, skills, and career motivations. You'll also get essential context about the role, the team, and how you can contribute towards our goals.


Round 2 - Craft Interview:


You'll meet some team members to discuss the technical task in more depth, work through some technical questions related to your expertise and cover past projects, experience and career aspirations.


Round 3 - Technical Task:


If you're applying for a technical role, you may be given a short take-home task to assess your skills and approach to problem-solving. This could be a real-life business scenario to unpack, a presentation, a test or a collaboration exercise. (Please note, depending on the role, the order of rounds 2 & 3 are interchangeable)


Round 4 - Values interview:


You'll be able to meet with the Department Head for a short, informal conversation to understand your potential impact, the growth area we can support, and how aligned you are with our values and culture.


Important Information

If there are any adjustments we can make that would make you more comfortable at any point in the interview process, please don't hesitate to let us know.


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer Lead - LLM/Python/GenAI
Description:
Opportunity: Full Time, 8 hours India time

Contract length: 6-12 Months

Must-Have

Total Years Of exp- 7+ years experience mandatory

Mandatory Skills: Python- 7 years, Machine Learning - 3 years, LLM - 3 years.

Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS

Introduction

We are seeking experienced professionals with expertise in Large Language Models (LLM) to join a dynamic team working on next-generation products. In this role, you will collaborate with other engineers across various skill sets, driving innovative solutions for our clients.

Required Skills


7+ years of professional experience in building Machine Learning models & systems
1+ years of hands-on experience with LLMs and Generative AI, particularly prompt engineering, RAG, and agents
Expertise in business analysis, requirement gathering, and solution workflow design for GenAI/ML projects
Proven ability to drive client engagement and align development teams toward a technical roadmap
Proficient in programming with Python, Langchain, and SQL
Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS
Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with business SMEs

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do You want to be part of transforming how we work with AI and machine learning at scale at Danske Bank?

Are you a skilled ML engineer with a proven track record of deploying and managing Machine Learning models in multiple environments? Do you have a passion for automation, scalability and for optimizing ML workflows? If so, you might just be the one we are looking for.

Danske Bank has a clear strategy that focuses on growth and profitability. Data Driven Danske is the one underlying data strategy for the bank; a comprehensive vision and foundation for building and harnessing data & analytics capabilities to enable delivery of the business strategy in a sustainable and repeatable fashion.

From an AI/ML perspective, this is what we in Group Data & Analytics have committed to; namely to enable the organisation to adopt and scale AI/ML by defining and executing the one -group-wide data strategy, incl. how AI/algorithms transform and produces lower-level abstractions of the same.

In Data Science & AI (part of Group Data & Analytics) we are ramping up to build a highly specialized team that partners with our core business- and development teams to deliver solutions in e.g. our product offering such as the Mobile Bank, e-Bank, website and other tooling for frontline advisors.

About The Role

Currently, we are looking for strong candidates to help push our commercial agenda with a wide range of models, that identify customer needs, used to present to the customer their Next-Best-Action. Using data from customer interaction (messages, chats and calls) we develop ML solutions that help provide automatic replies and digital routing to create a better customer experience and lower costs from manual processes/handling. But this is only the beginning!

In Danske Bank we have a strategy to migrate to public cloud with AWS. You will play a vital role in defining and building the future Data Science platform, thereby to help accelerate the impact of Machine Leaning and AI across Danske Bank.

Anchored in Data Science & AI (Group Data & Analytics), but teaming up with business teams, we ensure that not only do we build the right things, but we also build it the right way.

About You


You would be able to tick of most of the points below (but not necessarily all):
Deep knowledge (5+ years) of MLOps from previous hands-on roles or solid experience as an ML Engineer.
Understanding of, and ability to think , IT architectures for scale.
Works independently, but thrives in teaming-up with skilled colleagues.
Ability to set a product vision and deliver on a roadmap.
Self-driven with an ability to work individually and with others in the team and organisation.
Outcome-oriented with a focus on delivering.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to bring the right stakeholders together.
Curious about product development, technology trends with a thirst for knowledge and self-improvement
Deployment and training of LLM’s


Experience with following or similar:


Python
Spark/PySpark
Airflow
SQL
Public Cloud providers (preferably AWS)
FAST API
MLFlow
Monitoring frameworks (Prometheus, Graphana etc.)
Containerisation (ex. Kubernetees, Docker, Openshift)
CI/CD pipelines
Git/Azure DevOps


About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a data driven bank. To make better decisions - for our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

If this sounds like you, don't hesitate to apply!

If you want to hear more about this exciting role, do not hesitate contact Michael Thruesen on mail; mthru@danskebank.dk
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer at new Human-Centered Social Network Startup
Description:
At Lifebonder, we’re on a mission to break social media addiction, fake personas, cyber-bullying, cancel culture, and loneliness by providing a Mesaverse that lives up to the promise of what social media can be: A safe place to facilitate human connections rather than replace them.

We want to make the world a better place by filling a growing need for direct socializing outside social media - connecting people in friendships that are human, profound, and meaningful. LifeBonder makes it easy for people to connect in a deeper reality through shared spaces, values, and goals because our vision is to build social bonds in real life.

Job brief

We are actively searching for a talented and experienced Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to join our team.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the development and implementation of cutting-edge artificial intelligence.

Your responsibilities will involve designing and constructing sophisticated machine learning models, as well as refining and updating systems.

In order to thrive in this position, you must possess exceptional skills in statistics and programming, as well as a deep understanding of data science and software engineering principles.

Your ultimate objective will be to create highly efficient self-learning applications that can adapt and evolve over time, pushing the boundaries of AI technology. Join us and be at the forefront of innovation in the field of machine learning.

Responsibilities


Study and transform data science prototypes
Design machine learning systems
Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
Develop machine learning application according to requirements
Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
Run machine learning tests and experiments
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
Train and retrain systems when necessary
Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks
Keep abreast of developments in the field


Requirements And Skills


Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role
Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms
Ability to write robust code in Python, Java and R
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master’s degree is a plus


What We Offer


We are a small team of endlessly dedicated developers offering a fun and friendly work environment where everyone is equal.
We offer real-world work experience and exciting challenges where you can make a real difference.
Excellent recommendations and when you’re ready to move on, we’ve got your back.
Full-time hires at a later date.


For more information or questions please contact us at development@lifebonder.com or phone number
Show more

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 2 - 10 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master’s degree is a plus


What We Offer


We are a small team of endlessly dedicated developers offering a fun and friendly work environment where everyone is equal.
We offer real-world work experience and exciting challenges where you can make a real difference.
Excellent recommendations and when you’re ready to move on, we’ve got your back.
Full-time hires at a later date.


For more information or questions please contact us at development@lifebonder.com or phone number
Show more
HTML:
At Lifebonder, we’re on a mission to break social media addiction, fake personas, cyber-bullying, cancel culture, and loneliness by providing a Mesaverse that lives up to the promise of what social media can be: A safe place to facilitate human connections rather than replace them.

We want to make the world a better place by filling a growing need for direct socializing outside social media - connecting people in friendships that are human, profound, and meaningful. LifeBonder makes it easy for people to connect in a deeper reality through shared spaces, values, and goals because our vision is to build social bonds in real life.

Job brief

We are actively searching for a talented and experienced Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to join our team.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the development and implementation of cutting-edge artificial intelligence.

Your responsibilities will involve designing and constructing sophisticated machine learning models, as well as refining and updating systems.

In order to thrive in this position, you must possess exceptional skills in statistics and programming, as well as a deep understanding of data science and software engineering principles.

Your ultimate objective will be to create highly efficient self-learning applications that can adapt and evolve over time, pushing the boundaries of AI technology. Join us and be at the forefront of innovation in the field of machine learning.

Responsibilities

  • Study and transform data science prototypes
  • Design machine learning systems
  • Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
  • Develop machine learning application according to requirements
  • Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
  • Run machine learning tests and experiments
  • Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
  • Train and retrain systems when necessary
  • Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks
  • Keep abreast of developments in the field

Requirements And Skills

  • Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role
  • Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms
  • Ability to write robust code in Python, Java and R
  • Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work in a team
  • Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
  • BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master’s degree is a plus

What We Offer

  • We are a small team of endlessly dedicated developers offering a fun and friendly work environment where everyone is equal.
  • We offer real-world work experience and exciting challenges where you can make a real difference.
  • Excellent recommendations and when you’re ready to move on, we’ve got your back.
  • Full-time hires at a later date.

For more information or questions please contact us at development@lifebonder.com or phone number

Title: AI Engineer - Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Engineer - Copenhagen:

AI is the word on everyone's lips right now, especially when it comes to how we can leverage and utilise data.

Question is, how do you know which business is serious about their AI strategy?

I am now working with an innovation driven start-up who are in the process of releasing their first AI product to market.

Specialising in process automation while taking key details into account like compliance and risk monitoring. Helping to smoothly integrate data into a tailored, data driven product.

Offering a one-stop-shop platform for you to get to know your business and make the most out of your data!

You will be joining a cross-collaborative team who all contribute towards the businesses evolution.

Having a start-up feel brings you fresh insight through your new, highly talented colleagues!

What we hope to see from you:


Previous experience with practical AI deployment
Previous experience in python coding and problem solving
Skilled in modern data science and machine learning techniques
The ability to design, deploy and demonstrate your ideas to colleagues
The ability to deliver as an individual and in a team
Confidence to share your opinion and spar with both tech and business driven team members
Strong communicator with fluency in English (written & verbal)


The office is based in central Copenhagen with a high level of flexibility to make your working week suit you and your personal life.

If you want know more, please reach out!

d.nichol@nigelfrank.com

Title: Python Backend Developer - Remote
Description:
Location: Latin America/Europe - Permanent Remote

Experience: 6 - 15 Years

Role Type: Contracting Full Time (40 Hrs/week)

Overlap Hours: 8 Hours PST time

Contract Duration: 3-6 Months

Mandatory Skills

Python- 5 years,

Django- 5 years,

SQL-5 years.

Hands-on experience with the AWS cloud is mandatory

Total years of exp- 6+ years experience mandatory

Required Skills


7+ years of experience in software development - ( Purely backend )
Coding experience in server-side programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, Ruby) as well as database languages (SQL)
Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)
Past experience and success in building and supporting scalable APIs, services, or applications
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


About The Role

A globally recognised firm is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join their Carriers team! The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, he/she will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for their team and the Engineering team.

Responsibility

Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs that can handle millions of requests a day.


Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns from the data model, queuing of jobs, application layering and container-based software distribution.
Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
Participate in peer reviews, testing and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics to ensure performance and quality.
Work with a sense of urgency and iterate quickly in an agile process.
Mentor more junior engineers on engineering best practices.
Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges and translate those into technical solutions.

Title: Software Engineer to ALTEN Denmark
Description:
Are you a talented Software Engineer seeking your next opportunity? Join our Engineering team in Denmark, where exciting challenges await!

Your role as Software Engineer:

As a Software Engineer at ALTEN, you will play a key role in strengthening the section for integration of software and hardware. You will be a part of a talented team where you develop state of the art technology together with electronics engineers, firmware and software developers.

Who are you?

To be a good match for the role we we believe that you have a great experience in C++, it could be both close to the hardware or object oriented. Experience in C is also of interest. You are a driven and engaged colleague with a problem-solving mind and a team player. We also see that you have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, or other equivalent education and at least 5+ years of experience within a relevant area.




We also think our new colleague have experience from:

Python or Java
SQL
Machine learning (TensorFloe, Scikit-learn)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google cloud)




It is meritorious if you also have:

experience of UX design
experience working with control algorithms
experience of version control systems




Location: Aarhus, Denmark.




The recruitment process is ongoing- if you are interested do not hesitate to apply right away!




As part of our team, you can expect the following:

Full-time employment at ALTEN Denmark

Opportunities for international mobility

Access to internal education, certifications, and professional development programs offered by ALTEN Academy

Diverse range of assignments with different clients and industries

Career coaching and guidance with the support of our dedicated Business Managers




About ALTEN:

ALTEN is a leading provider of outsourced Engineering and Technology Services, operating in over 35 countries with a workforce of more than 57,000 employees. In Denmark, ALTEN has been on a successful growth trajectory since 2019, delivering innovative solutions within Engineering and Life Science. Our team of skilled engineers undertakes complex and technically demanding projects across various industries, collaborating with renowned companies throughout the value chain and are presented in various locations in Denmark!

Title: Software engineer for ARTificial Mind
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

We have been creating AI art for eight years (primarily conversation-driven artworks with LLMs) and have achieved international recognition with exhibitions at some of the world's largest museums, as well as NASA's section of the International Space Station. Our DNA is in digital interactive art with machine learning - all built upon a foundation of great teamwork. You will work closely with artist and founder Cecilie Waagner Falkenstrøm and the team's other creatives and software developers.

Job Description

You will become a central part of our dev team, working to develop our interactive art projects. The most important thing is that you are a talented programmer and a strong generalist, who dares to learn new technologies, and are motivated to apply state-of-the-art research in the context of an art exhibition. It is a great advantage if you have experience with LLM (Large Language Models) and machine learning. You will build software projects that integrate data from a number of different sources in immersive interactive art installations. Work tasks will be very broad - ranging from self-hosting, running and evaluating new language models, to integrating 3D cameras with a game engine, to managing parallel rendering of larger Blender projects, to troubleshooting software art installations on-site at a museum.

Technical Details

We mostly work in Python, but it happens that we write in new and different languages e.g. Nim, Rust, Elm, and Typescript. We mostly work on Linux, and host everything in Docker on Linux servers, configured using Ansible. Our GPU machines are physically located in the office, and we manage all our own data and compute. Generally, you decide which tools should be used to solve a task, but it is expected that you are competent with Python, web technologies (HTML, JS), and Linux servers.

Areas Of Responsibility

(We’re looking to hire two dedicated software developers, so you will work with one or more of these areas, depending on your qualifications and interests)


Scouring the internet for new technology research that can be applied in an artistic context (and writing the glue-code to make stuff work in an installation).
Design and implementation of server-side services to execute pre-trained machine learning models.
Pre-processing datasets for training or fine-tuning models.
Managing training or fine-tuning processes on our GPU servers.
Post-processing rendered media output (e.g. upscaling, re-encoding, ffmpeg-y stuff).
Monitoring, profiling and maintaining existing services.


Qualifications


A strong background in back-end development.
Experience hosting web services on Linux servers.
Experience programming in Python.


Advantage, But Not Required


Experience working with large language models.
Experience with machine learning technologies in general.


We Offer


An exciting and challenging position in an innovative and creative environment.
You will be a core member of our team and work closely with software developers as well as creatives.
Opportunity to work with and in open source, and a strong culture of contributing to copyleft projects.
You will be part of an artistic process from the idea generation to the code implementation.


We’re looking forward to meeting you.

For more information or questions please contact us at ao@artificialmind.ai or phone number 29805168
Show more

Title: Python Software Engineer (Data Science Team)
Description:
This role can be full-remote from within the EU.

We are a remote-first, international SaaS company dedicated to helping businesses find and target the right accounts primed for conversion. By merging Leadfeeder and Echobot, we've brought together two leading companies to create a powerful sales intelligence and web visitor identification platform that gives sales and marketing teams the real time data, insights, and tools they need to win more deals.

What makes us unique? Originating in Finland and Germany, the country with the highest privacy standards in Europe, Dealfront is built on a foundation of compliance and transparency. Our platform ensures users know exactly where the data comes from, maintaining integrity while enhancing profitability.

Join our diverse and dynamic team of over 270 Dealfronters spread across 40 countries. Together, let's redefine success for B2B companies across Europe and beyond. Join us and be a part of our journey to transform the way businesses win more deals!

Position Overview

We are looking for an experienced Python Software Engineer to join the Data Science team. In this role, you help to bridge the gap between data science models and production environments while ensuring reliability, performance, and scalability of our solutions.

Being part of the Data Science team, you play an active role in shaping, discussing, learning and experiencing developments in an exciting field, while you always advocate software quality. You become part of a nice, motivated and skilled team in which everyone pulls together.

What You'll Work On


Design and implementation of efficient processing pipelines, mainly in Python
Implement model APIs and integrate models into existing software systems
Support the translation of data science models from prototypes to production-ready code
Ensure robust CI/CD pipelines for smooth deployment and version control
Collaborate with data scientists to design software solutions that align with data science workflows
Implement data quality controls, logging, and monitoring systems
Document code, processes, and best practices for maintainability
Share insights and mentor other team members on software engineering principles



Requirements


At least 3 years of software development experience, mostly in Python
Interest in working with data-centric applications
Good understanding of GIT workflows, CI/CD + working with Unit Tests
Solid experience in interacting with technologies such as SQL (especially PostgreSQL), Kafka, Redis, Solr/Opensearch
Ability to help and improve the work of your colleagues through your teamwork and communication skills
Desired: Experience with a K8s environment and Docker
Be physically located within European timezones



Benefits


In this role, your contributions will directly influence the future direction and success of our products, shaping their growth and ensuring they meet the evolving needs of our customers
The chance to work with a very knowledgeable, high-achieving and fun team
An international, diverse, dynamic and committed work environment
The opportunity to work remotely, with a flexible work schedule
Mental Health support with Auntie
Annual company retreats in sunny locations and team off-sites :)


We encourage all interested candidates to apply, even if you don't meet all of the criteria listed.

We value diversity and inclusion in our workplace and welcome applications from candidates across all backgrounds and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or any other protected characteristics.

Title: Data Science & AI Lead
Description:
Join Bunker Holding as our Data Science & AI Lead to drive innovation and shape the future of bunker trading. Lead the design of groundbreaking AI solutions, inspire a diverse team, and turn business ideas into impactful results. Work in a dynamic environment where your expertise will thrive and make a significant impact.







About Us

Bunker Holding is one of the world’s leading companies in bunker trading. Our history as one of the pioneers in bunkering inspires us to be ever forward-looking and goal oriented. Family ownership allows us to remain grounded in our values, and to stay the course in our vision of sustainable development.

We are dedicated to leveraging data and AI to enhance our operational efficiency and drive innovation. Our team thrives on diversity and inclusivity, believing that a wide range of perspectives leads to groundbreaking solutions and a stronger organization.







Position Overview

We are seeking a visionary Data Science & AI Lead to accelerate our efforts in harnessing data to create value across our business. In this role, you will be spending time in our business and ensuring that business ideas are transformed into practical, impactful solutions. Together with our Director of Architecture and Intelligence, you’ll build and drive a new established function: Data Science & AI Center of Excellence (CoE) - which aims to drive innovation and integrate AI technologies by aligning initiatives with business goals, fostering cross-departmental collaboration, and ensuring scalable and sustainable practices. This approach will enhance organizational performance and maintain a competitive edge.”

You’ll collaborate with dynamic cross-functional teams to uncover key data-driven opportunities in the bunkering industry and bridge the gap between business stakeholders and technical teams for seamless communication and alignment.

Additionally, you’ll lead the design and implementation of innovative AI models and data analytics that tackle industry challenges, optimizing fuel logistics, pricing, and customer satisfaction. Inspire a culture of continuous improvement and excellence within the data science team, staying ahead with emerging technologies. Your hands-on expertise in data analysis, modeling, and coding will be invaluable in guiding and mentoring team members.




Your key responsibilities will thus include:

Drive AI strategies to achieve ambitious goals
Align business and IT for seamless communication
Design innovative and scalable AI solutions
Inspire continuous improvement and excellence
Promote diversity and inclusion within the team







What do you bring?

Bring your passion and expertise to our team with a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field, and 5-7 years of experience in data science or AI. If you have experience in the maritime or bunkering industry, that's an advantage!

Showcase your technical prowess in programming and machine learning frameworks, and use your industry knowledge to turn business needs into innovative solutions.

Inspire and lead your team with your exceptional communication and problem-solving skills. Embrace our dynamic environment with enthusiasm, ready to learn and adapt to new technologies.




Specifically, we expect you to have:

Bachelor's or Master's in Data Science or related field; Ph.D. is a plus
5-7 years of experience in data science or AI
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong business acumen in the bunkering industry
Excellent leadership and problem-solving skills
Adaptability to fast-paced, dynamic environments







Why Join Us?

Join our team and help shape the future of the bunkering industry with innovative, data-driven solutions. Work in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment where your ideas are celebrated and encouraged. Experience ample opportunities for professional growth and career advancement within a leading company. Become part of a diverse and inclusive team dedicated to creating a supportive environment where everyone thrives.

The position is in Middelfart or Aarhus, and travels to our location in Middelfart on weekly basis is to be expected.







How to apply

Note that applications are handled on an ongoing basis. So please send your application and CV as soon as possible by filling in the form below.

In case you have any questions about the position, please contact Director of Architecture and Intelligence, Anders Butzbach Christensen on +45 88 81 17 64.

We are already looking forward to hearing from you!

Please be advised that response times for applications may be extended due to the summer holiday period.







Bunker Holding is the global leader in purchasing, selling, and supplying marine fuel and lube oil as well as providing risk management and other vital services for the shipping industry. The company operates via more than 1,660 ports worldwide and is present in 32 countries with 62 offices and more than 1,500 skilled employees.

The group has a long history but remains forward-looking and focused on answering the needs and challenges of an ever-changing industry.

Bunker Holding is the largest company in the USTC Group, a family-owned company based in Denmark. USTC holds activities in oil & energy, ship owning, shipping & door-to-door logistics, risk management, car activities, IT, sustainable energy, and environment & recycling. The USTC Group is currently present with more than 160 offices in 40 countries and employs more than 4,300 people worldwide.

Read more at https://www.bunker-holding.com/

Show more
