Title: Senior Safety Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your experience with data science might be just what we’re looking for.
You can be part of transformational initiatives that will impact the field of patient safety.
Your enthusiasm for providing data-based insights will help us progress our understanding of the safety of our products for the benefit of patients.
Your skillset and contributions will enable us to make efficient business decisions.



Your new role

As Senior Safety Data Scientist, you’ll play an important role in shaping our digital transformation journey. You’ll leverage your data science expertise to advance our safety case management and signal detection processes across a variety of data sources. You’ll have the freedom to explore and implement solutions in a collaborative, cross-functional environment. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of patient safety, working closely with key global stakeholders across Global Patient Safety, R&D, IT and external partners.

Your future team

GPS Technologies is part of Global Patient Safety. You will join our team of 5 colleagues who values expertise and a hands-on approach to transforming business needs into robust technical realities. Our culture is characterized by a flat hierarchy that encourages swift decision-making, where every colleague is a key player, and every day is an opportunity to collaborate, develop, and make a tangible impact. Join us and be part of a team that not only excels professionally but also values the joy of camaraderie and shared success.

The position is based in our offices in Valby, Denmark.

What You Bring To The Team


Experience with applying Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) algorithms to both structured and unstructured data sources, including internal safety data, real world data (RWD), digital health (DH) applications.
Proficiency in creating and implementing self-service analytical tools and frameworks.
Strong problem-solving capabilities and advanced analytical skills, and the ability to comprehend and apply complex concepts through abstract reasoning.
Advanced communication and interpersonal skills.



Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include a few lines about your motivation for applying. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions, please contact Signe Vognsen, Senior Director, svog@lundbeck.com. Applications must be received by 22nd September 2024.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).

#AdvancingBrainHealth #FocusedInnovator

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

Title: Python Backend Developer
Description:
Location: Latin America/Europe - Permanent Remote

Experience: 6 - 15 Years

Role Type: Contracting Full Time (40 Hrs/week)

Overlap Hours: 8 Hours PST time

Contract Duration: 3-6 Months

Mandatory Skills

Python- 5 years,

Django- 5 years,

SQL-5 years.

Hands-on experience with the AWS cloud is mandatory

Total years of exp- 6+ years experience mandatory

Required Skills


7+ years of experience in software development - ( Purely backend )
Coding experience in server-side programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, Ruby) as well as database languages (SQL)
Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)
Past experience and success in building and supporting scalable APIs, services, or applications
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


About The Role

A globally recognised firm is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join their Carriers team! The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, he/she will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for their team and the Engineering team.

Responsibility

Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs that can handle millions of requests a day.


Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns from the data model, queuing of jobs, application layering and container-based software distribution.
Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
Participate in peer reviews, testing and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics to ensure performance and quality.
Work with a sense of urgency and iterate quickly in an agile process.
Mentor more junior engineers on engineering best practices.
Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges and translate those into technical solutions.

Title: Data Scientist (unpaid, must already be Europe based)
Description:
We're looking for an experienced (yes we know, it's an unpaid internship), motivated, driven and proactive team member to join us. From data collection, data cleaning, ETL, to recommendation engine - you will experience a broad spectre of data science.

We expect the internship to be for 6 months and work hours per week around 20.

Join an international SaaS startup with global expansion and growth ambitions, helping to reduce carbon emissions in transportation.

We are a growing, diverse, and international team focused on doing our part in reducing the exacerbation of carbon dioxide emissions from passenger cars. We do this by nudging consumers to buy electric vehicles (EV) and we collaborate with businesses as well as municipalities to support consumers in entering the market for EVs.

The team is developing a digital marketplace where consumers can learn about EVs and get help throughout their purchase journey to acquire a car. Another way to help and guide our stakeholders is through content.

The platform has 3 target audiences - consumer, corporate, government.

We are passionate and working hard to strengthen the development of the platform and are proud of the outcome so far.

We're looking for an intern to further progress the endeavor.

We have a good data science/data management team and need to add an additional capable data science team member.

We provide a B2C and B2B marketplace platform (SaaS) in the automobile industry, focusing on hybrid- and electric cars. We also partner with B2G for charging infrastructure. You don't have to be knowledgeable in the automotive industry but good at the research part, creative/visionary, an avid learner and curious for answers and solutions.

No need to be experienced or knowledgeable in the automotive sector, you need to be excellent at connecting some dots, proficient in data science and a wizard with data.

We are looking for the right candidate to help us further progress with data science - we need data science for our continuous platform development.

What we use: Python, Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Flask to create ML services, MLOps

Expectations


Data Collection and Data Management
Keep our database updated with latest car data
Data exploration, study, development and validation of classic ML models
Data collection using LLMs
Participation in the product development based on available data
Critical thinker
Observant, curious
Able to challenge the team
Active listening skills
Good interpersonal skills, including the ability to collaborate with different teams and team members


When joining you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, shaping the future of our company. We have a team and looking to add an additional member.

This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self and celebrated for the skills, talent, curiousness, problem-solving, perspective, solution, and honest opinion you bring to the table.

If you are an introvert or someone who doesn't handle large groups that easily, there is room for you here. We believe that diverse, inclusive teams drive innovation, performance, and excellence.

We provide equal opportunities without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, religion, political opinion, nationality, ethnic background, social origin, social status, indigenous status, disability, age.
Show more

Title: Data science studiejob hos Publicis Intelligence
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Publicis Groupe er den andenstørste medie- og reklamebureaugruppe i verden med over 85.000 specialister. Vi har en holistisk tilgang til at løse vores kunders udfordringer, da vi forener vores ekspertise inden for medier, kreativitet, data og teknologi og tilbyder integrerede løsninger, transformative ideer og overbevisende forbrugeroplevelser. Vi kalder det Power Of One.





På vores danske kontor sidder vi 70 medarbejdere fokuseret på at levere integrerede løsninger til vores lokale og internationale kunder inden for medier, kreativitet, data & teknologi samt forskning & strategi. Vi er stolte vindere af mange priser og nomineringer, både i Danmark og internationalt. Men intet gør os stoltere end at arbejde med kunder og brands som Salling Group, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Renault, Nestlé, Disney, Pfizer, Haleon, LVMH og mange flere.





Vores fantastisk kontor er lokaliseret i centrum af København tæt placeret på bus, Metro og togstation.




Stillingsbeskrivelse



Besidder du en solid matematisk profil med interesse for analyse, indsigter og strategi? Drømmer du om en karriere inden for konsulentbranchen, hvor du udforsker store datamængder for at opdage sammenhænge og indsigter, som du anvender til at levere strategisk rådgivning til nogle af landets største virksomheder samt internationale kunder? Så er du måske vores nye Junior Data Scientist!


Du vil blive en del af et ambitiøst team, der stræber efter at blive de bedste inden for vores fag, hvor vi løbende arbejder med banebrydende projekter inden for marketingvidenskab. Vi er et travlt og målrettet team med en uformel omgangstone, hvor stærke kollegiale relationer vægter højt. Vi løfter i flok og har mange tværfaglige projekter, hvorfor intern sparring og kompetenceudvikling danner grundstenen for vores måde at arbejde på. Dette gælder også vores studentermedhjælpere, og du vil have mulighed for at skrive din kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.

I Publicis Intelligence kommer du til at arbejde med mange aspekter inden for markedsanalyse og forbrugerindsigter. Du vil have din primære arbejdsgang i tæt samarbejde med resten af Insights teamets konsulenter, hvor du vil komme til at arbejde med vores spritnye dataplatform.


Som Junior Data Scientist, kommer du primært til at supportere konsulenterne i teamet med udførelse af dataopgaver til forbruger- og markedsanalyser til bureauets kunder.


Stillingen er 15-20 timer om ugen med opstart hurtigst muligt.


Din arbejdsdag vil typisk bestå af nedenstående arbejdsopgaver:


Databearbejdning i Python, R, Excel eller Alteryx
Validering og kvalitetstjek af data
Udarbejdelse af analyser som kan præsenteres af teamets konsulenter
Ad hoc markedsanalyser eller analyser om forbrugeradfærd i f.eks. Index Danmark


Kvalifikationer


Du er i slutningen af din bachelor eller lige startet på din kandidat i fx Data Science, Matematik, Erhvervsøkonomi el.lign.
Du er superbruger af Office-pakken.
Du er udpræget analytisk med forståelse af datastruktur.
Du har kendskab til Alteryx, Python, R og/eller SPSS.
Det vil være en fordel, men ikke et krav, at du har erfaring med et dataanalyse- og visualiseringsværktøj, såsom Power BI eller Tableau.
Du har drive, engagement og er opsøgende, samt ikke er bange for at påtage dig ansvar, som du selvstændigt trives med at bære.
Du kan formulere dig klart og tydeligt på både dansk og engelsk – både i skrift og i tale.
Du er villig til at arbejde med korte deadlines og mere intensivt i perioder med spidsbelastning.


Yderligere oplysninger



Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig?


Et lærerigt arbejdsmiljø med fokus på personlig og faglig udvikling, hvor du selv er med til at definere retningen for egen udvikling samt egne interesseområder.
Et selvstændigt og ansvarsfuldt job i et team med stærke ambitioner og mål.
Fleksible arbejdstider, som du selv planlægger inden for det aftalte timeantal, samt særlig fleksibilitet i eksamensperioder.
Mulighed for at skrive kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.
Gode kollegiale relationer i et livligt kontormiljø placeret i hjertet af København K med masser af sociale og faglige arrangementer.

Er du interesseret?


Så ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning! Hvis du har spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Maya Jensen på maya.jensen@publicisgroupe.com.


Vi holder løbende samtaler, så send din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Ansøgningen skal sendes sammen med dit cv og eventuelle referencer.


Show more
HTML:
Publicis Groupe er den andenstørste medie- og reklamebureaugruppe i verden med over 85.000 specialister. Vi har en holistisk tilgang til at løse vores kunders udfordringer, da vi forener vores ekspertise inden for medier, kreativitet, data og teknologi og tilbyder integrerede løsninger, transformative ideer og overbevisende forbrugeroplevelser. Vi kalder det Power Of One.


På vores danske kontor sidder vi 70 medarbejdere fokuseret på at levere integrerede løsninger til vores lokale og internationale kunder inden for medier, kreativitet, data & teknologi samt forskning & strategi. Vi er stolte vindere af mange priser og nomineringer, både i Danmark og internationalt. Men intet gør os stoltere end at arbejde med kunder og brands som Salling Group, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Renault, Nestlé, Disney, Pfizer, Haleon, LVMH og mange flere.


Vores fantastisk kontor er lokaliseret i centrum af København tæt placeret på bus, Metro og togstation.


Stillingsbeskrivelse

Besidder du en solid matematisk profil med interesse for analyse, indsigter og strategi? Drømmer du om en karriere inden for konsulentbranchen, hvor du udforsker store datamængder for at opdage sammenhænge og indsigter, som du anvender til at levere strategisk rådgivning til nogle af landets største virksomheder samt internationale kunder? Title: Senior ML engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you our next Senior Machine Learning Engineer?

At Go Autonomous, we are on a mission to change the future of autonomous commerce. As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will join our ML Foundation Team, where you will play a critical role in developing and optimizing foundational AI models. Collaborating with cross-functional teams such as AI Implementation, Customer Success, Software Development, Data Annotation, and Leadership, you'll ensure that our models are seamlessly integrated with our platform and meet customer needs.

Your Role


Design, develop, and optimize machine learning models, ensuring high performance and scalability.
Collaborate closely with other ML engineers and cross-functional teams to align development with business and customer requirements.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our AI-driven products.
Analyze dependencies to ensure models integrate well with the software platform.
Provide insights and solutions to enhance our core ML offerings.


What We Expect


5+ years of experience working in Machine Learning or AI.
Proficiency in Python and strong understanding of foundational AI/ML concepts.
Solid understanding of PyTorch and transformers.
Experience with model training, optimization, and deployment.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams.


Nice-to-have


Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP).
Familiarity with MLOps tools (e.g., K8s)


What We Offer


An opportunity to work in a highly agile, non-hierarchical, and innovative environment.
A role that directly impacts the future of commerce through cutting-edge AI technologies.
Collaboration with a talented and diverse team that values meritocracy and openness .


Location: We are based at Kultorvet, near Nørreport station and Metro. You must be able to commute to our office as we are not hiring for remote positions.

For more information or questions please contact us at jacob.ramlov@goautonomous.io or phone number 40971220

Title: Front Officer Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Front Office Developer - Python & C# (Energy or Finance Experince Needed)




We are seeking a skilled Front Office Developer with expertise in Python and C# to join a dynamic team in Copenhagen.




Front Office Developer

Up to 70,000 Krones Per Month

Copenhagen Based Office (3 - 4 days in the office)

Permanent role

Key Skills Python and C#




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain front office applications for trading, risk management, and analytics.
Collaborate with traders, analysts, and stakeholders to implement innovative solutions.
Enhance system performance and optimize code for fast-paced trading environments.
Integrate complex data from energy and financial markets into scalable systems.
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues in real-time.

What We're Looking For:

Proven experience in Python & C# development within front office environments.
AWS (ECS, Lambda, RDS, CloudWatch, etc.), Azure DevOps (CI/CD)
Strong understanding of energy and financial markets.
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced trading environment.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Title: Data Science Student Assistant
Description:
Drive meaningful change

Are you a curious and passionate student who just started your master’s degree and eager to dive into the world of data science? Join us as a Data Science Student Assistant and play a key role in maintaining and improving our forecasting models, assisting with model development, and advancing our data science infrastructure. If you're ready to make an impact while growing your skills, we are looking forward to hearing from you!




Get a glimpse of our world

As a Data Science Student, you'll join an international team dedicated to developing innovative, data-driven solutions to core business challenges. Our diverse group ensures that the entire organization relies on high-quality data products for decision-making.

In this role, you'll need curiosity and a passion for data exploration. You should be eager to uncover insights and communicate your findings effectively to non-technical audiences. You'll take ownership of your tasks and find motivation in delivering impactful results, by using tools like:

A diverse range of Machine Learning models, including both supervised and unsupervised learning.
A robust Data Science Tech Stack: Python, Jupyter Lab/Notebooks, Docker.
A cutting-edge Cloud Stack: Microsoft Azure, Spark, Databricks, Delta Lake.




Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

You'll work closely with stakeholders across the organization, as well as with business intelligence developers, analysts, and data engineers, to ensure our models and infrastructure meet the highest standards.

As a Data Science Student Assistant, you will have the opportunity to:

Model Maintenance: Actively maintain, monitor, improve, and document our forecasting models.
Model Development: Assist with the initial phases of developing new forecasting models.
Data Science Research: Conduct research on emerging methods, tools, and models, and share your findings with the team.
Technical Infrastructure Development: Contribute to maintaining and improving our cutting-edge data science infrastructure.




Fuel for your success in the role

We are looking for someone who is curious about data and passionate about uncovering insights that drive business decisions. Ideally you will have:

Education: You have about 1,5 or 2 years left of your master’s degree in a data science-related field (e.g., computer science, IT, mathematics/statistics, economics).
Technical Skills:

Intermediate-level Python programming skills.

Data Science - machine learning, data wrangling, data analysis, and visualization.

Communication: Good oral and written communication skills in English.




Additional Interests (not required but beneficial):

Knowledge of SQL, Spark, ETL processes, CI/CD processes, Linux commands, Web APIs, MLOps, and Dashboards.




Would you like to know more about us?

Are you the right match for this position? Then please follow the link and apply for this exciting position before the application deadline on September 27th. Interviews will be conducted throughout the application period. The position is to be filled as soon as possible, and we process applications continuously.

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager, Mihai Popovici, Data Science Team Lead, mihai.popovici@abacusmedicine.com.




Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.




Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,300 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Show more

Title: MBT Developers - Denmark
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Belmont Lavan Ltd is actively seeking talented MBT (Model-Based Testing) Developers to become part of our innovative team in Denmark. If you're passionate about software testing and have experience with model-based methodologies, we want you!

Responsibilities:


Design and develop advanced model-based testing frameworks
Engage with stakeholders to analyze system requirements and create effective testing models
Implement automated test cases derived from models to ensure comprehensive software coverage
Monitor testing results, identify defects, and liaise with development teams for swift resolution
Enhance testing methodologies to elevate software quality and efficiency
Maintain accurate documentation of testing processes and results



Requirements

Required Skills and Experience:


Strong background in software development or quality assurance with a focus on model-based testing
Proficient in the use of MBT tools and frameworks
Experience with programming languages such as Java, Python, or C#
Solid understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Attention to detail and a drive for high-quality outcomes
Strong communication and collaboration skills



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with performance testing or load testing tools
Knowledge of additional testing frameworks and methodologies
Industry-related experience is a bonus



Assignment Duration: Initially a 6-month contract with the possibility of extension.

Location: Denmark, with flexible options for remote work.

Required skills: Python, Java, Kubernetes, Kafka

Preferred skills: FX

Languages: English
Show more

Title: LEAP Scientist
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have the flair for using data to drive innovation in food science?

Are you passionate about using your scientific expertise in using data to drive innovation and sustainability in the global food chain? At FOSS Analytical, we’re looking for a talented scientist with a passion for developing new data and analytics approaches to join our LEAP innovation team!

As a LEAP scientist, you will be in a unique position to define the technology of the future. You will play a crucial role in developing new analytical solutions and providing new insights based on analytical data to enhance food quality and optimize the use of agricultural resources.




Innovating customer-driven solutions

You will be at the forefront of our efforts to address the challenges faced by the food and agricultural industries. The essence of the job is to identify and solve our customers’ challenges by developing innovative, sustainable, and value-driven analytical solutions. A key aspect of the job is being hands-on in building prototypes and demonstrating novel technological methodologies and new analytical measures.




Your responsibilities will include:




Collaborating closely with customers, partners, and colleagues across FOSS to understand market trends, customer needs, and industry drivers
Translating customer needs into innovative solutions to meet our customers' current and future needs in the food and agricultural sectors
Conducting cutting-edge research to develop new methodologies and technologies for sustainability, safety, and quality
Using your communication skills to act internally and externally as a project champion




We offer a challenging job at an international and innovative company

You will join a global company that is a world leader in analytical solutions for the food and agriculture industries. FOSS enables thousands of customers around the globe to make informed, data-driven decisions using dedicated analytical techniques. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with experts from diverse fields within and outside the company. Expect to face challenges and engage in meaningful work that makes a real difference in the agriculture and food industries.

You will be employed in the LEAP Innovation team, a part of Front End Innovation. Our working culture is based on trust and teamwork, and you can expect to be in an environment where we value and encourage your ideas. You will be working on projects with a global reach, and there will be opportunities for international travel to collaborate with colleagues and customers worldwide.




Do you have an innovative mindset?

We expect you to have a master’s degree or PhD in Food Science, Chemistry, or a related field. The preferred candidate will offer combined experiences from several fields, such as food chemistry, analytics applications in industry or laboratories, and data processing. While industrial or academic experience working with food analytics is preferred, it is not essential, nor is innovation or entrepreneurial experience.




To be successful in this role, you should have a passion for innovation and product development.




Do you have the vision, drive, and strong analytical skills to combine technological and market perspectives?
Do you have a strong track record of curiosity and willingness to dig deeply into customers' businesses?
Do you have the communication skills to engage with technical and non-technical audiences?




Join Us

If you are excited about the opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future for the food and agriculture industries, we want to hear from you! Please send us your application and relevant documentation as soon as possible. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so apply sooner rather than later. If you have any questions about the position, please reach out to Jonas Andersen, Head of LEAP Innovation, at joan@foss.dk or +45 2761 6459 or Principal Scientist Klavs Martin Sørensen at kmsn@foss.dk or +45 21 69 59 08.




FOSS is committed to maintaining an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. You can help us sustain an unbiased recruitment process by not including photo or age in your application.




FOSS

Today, more than 8 billion people around the world are dependent on nutritional food. Tons of food being produced in a million different ways and under varying conditions, creating challenges all the way from field to fork. One of them, obviously, being the effects it has on climate change.

FOSS helps the world’s 100 biggest food companies and more than 40,000 others around the world navigate exactly that with intelligent, data-driven and innovative analytical solutions. We are making sustainability a better business and we’re doing so as global market leader in our field – improving food quality, minimizing food waste, ensuring food safety, and securing fair payment.

Join a pioneering and innovative company in the food and agriculture industry. A company on a mission, with offices all around the world and 1,700 talented colleagues from more than 32 different countries.

Apply for job as LEAP scientist in Marketing & Front End Innovation

Show more

A key aspect of the job is being hands-on in building prototypes and demonstrating novel technological methodologies and new analytical measures.


Your responsibilities will include:


  • Collaborating closely with customers, partners, and colleagues across FOSS to understand market trends, customer needs, and industry drivers
  • Translating customer needs into innovative solutions to meet our customers' current and future needs in the food and agricultural sectors
  • Conducting cutting-edge research to develop new methodologies and technologies for sustainability, safety, and quality
  • Using your communication skills to act internally and externally as a project champion


We offer a challenging job at an international and innovative company

You will join a global company that is a world leader in analytical solutions for the food and agriculture industries. FOSS enables thousands of customers around the globe to make informed, data-driven decisions using dedicated analytical techniques. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with experts from diverse fields within and outside the company. Expect to face challenges and engage in meaningful work that makes a real difference in the agriculture and food industries.

You will be employed in the LEAP Innovation team, a part of Front End Innovation. Our working culture is based on trust and teamwork, and you can expect to be in an environment where we value and encourage your ideas. You will be working on projects with a global reach, and there will be opportunities for international travel to collaborate with colleagues and customers worldwide.


Do you have an innovative mindset?

We expect you to have a master’s degree or PhD in Food Science, Chemistry, or a related field. The preferred candidate will offer combined experiences from several fields, such as food chemistry, analytics applications in industry or laboratories, and data processing. While industrial or academic experience working with food analytics is preferred, it is not essential, nor is innovation or entrepreneurial experience.


To be successful in this role, you should have a passion for innovation and product development.


  • Do you have the vision, drive, and strong analytical skills to combine technological and market perspectives?
  • Do you have a strong track record of curiosity and willingness to dig deeply into customers' businesses?
  • Do you have the communication skills to engage with technical and non-technical audiences?


Join Us

If you are excited about the opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future for the food and agriculture industries, we want to hear from you! Please send us your application and relevant documentation as soon as possible. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so apply sooner rather than later. If you have any questions about the position, please reach out to Jonas Andersen, Head of LEAP Innovation, at joan@foss.dk or +45 2761 6459 or Principal Scientist Klavs Martin Sørensen at kmsn@foss.dk or +45 21 69 59 08.


FOSS is committed to maintaining an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. You can help us sustain an unbiased recruitment process by not including photo or age in your application.


FOSS

Today, more than 8 billion people around the world are dependent on nutritional food. Tons of food being produced in a million different ways and under varying conditions, creating challenges all the way from field to fork. One of them, obviously, being the effects it has on climate change.

FOSS helps the world’s 100 biggest food companies and more than 40,000 others around the world navigate exactly that with intelligent, data-driven and innovative analytical solutions. We are making sustainability a better business and we’re doing so as global market leader in our field – improving food quality, minimizing food waste, ensuring food safety, and securing fair payment.

Join a pioneering and innovative company in the food and agriculture industry. A company on a mission, with offices all around the world and 1,700 talented colleagues from more than 32 different countries.

Apply for job as LEAP scientist in Marketing & Front End Innovation

Title: Senior Software Engineer (C++, C, Python)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
A European company developing embedded systems for products in healthcare, science, robotics, and high-tech is looking for a Senior Software Engineer.

They have been on the market for more than 25 years, during which time it has been joined by more than 150 experts.

Its engineers are of the highest caliber in providing innovative and creative solutions in the areas of embedded software, web application software and cloud services. And they invite you to join the team.

You are offered relocation and a hybrid work schedule. The company's branch office is located in Best, Netherlands.

Your tasks on the position:


Designing and implementing the best solutions and architecture in a highly complex and multidisciplinary environment
Participation in all stages of software product development
Development of software interfaces to interact with real hardware
Algorithm implementation, work with object-oriented projects
Creating solutions and integrating BDD



Requirements


5+ years of experience in software development in C++
Knowledge of other programming languages such as Python, C or C#
Knowledge of methodologies and techniques like UML and Design Patterns
Familiarity of Agile, TDD and BDD
Master's or bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
English С1+



Will be an advantage:


Dutch language skills



Benefits


Competitive salary 5400-5830 EUR gross depending on your experience
Relocation package, relocation assistance
Thirteenth month payment
Hybrid schedule
Informal, open and collegial working atmosphere in the office
Bonuses (insurance package, a pension scheme, a study budget)
Interesting, innovative and challenging projects in ambitious work environments
Opportunities for professional and personal development

Title: Full Stack Developer ( Python/Flask)
Description:
🚀 Join Our Dynamic Team at Spotipo! 🚀

Position: Python/Flask Full Stack Developer

Salary: Up to $50,000/year

Experience: Minimum 5 years

Are You a Coding Maestro with a Love for Python?

At Spotipo, we're a small, tightly-knit team of tech enthusiasts passionate about delivering top-notch code at lightning speed to a diverse global clientele. From local mom-and-pop shops to massive corporations, we help improve the WiFi experience for thousands of guests worldwide. And we're looking for YOU to join our journey!

What You’ll Be Doing (what's a Must-have)


Crafting high-quality applications using Flask and solid Python expertise
Playing with Docker, MySQL/Redis, Linux, and Git (Github/Gitlab)
Enhancing our codebase with HTML/JavaScript and exploring new technologies like HTMX/Tailwind


Bonus Points If You Know


Celery, Faust-streaming, Clickhouse
Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Tailwind, Alpine.js
Networking/WiFi knowledge


Tools We Love & Use


GitHub
PyCharm
Buddy (CI)
Selenium (Testing)
Linear


Why You’ll Love Working With Us


Fully Remote: Work from anywhere you feel most productive
Flexible Timing: We believe in results, not clock-watching
Awesome Gear: Choose a MacBook or laptop that suits you
Endless Learning: From processing millions of events with Celery to optimizing Clickhouse queries, there's always something new to tackle


Exciting Times Ahead!

We're moving from React to HTMX/Tailwind, so if you're eager to experiment and innovate, now’s your chance!

Ready to Make an Impact?

Apply now, and let’s create something unique together!
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer Lead - LLM/Python/GenAI
Description:
Opportunity: Full Time, 8 hours India time

Contract length: 6-12 Months

Must-Have

Total Years Of exp- 7+ years experience mandatory

Mandatory Skills: Python- 7 years, Machine Learning - 3 years, LLM - 3 years.

Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS

Introduction

We are seeking experienced professionals with expertise in Large Language Models (LLM) to join a dynamic team working on next-generation products. In this role, you will collaborate with other engineers across various skill sets, driving innovative solutions for our clients.

Required Skills


7+ years of professional experience in building Machine Learning models & systems
1+ years of hands-on experience with LLMs and Generative AI, particularly prompt engineering, RAG, and agents
Expertise in business analysis, requirement gathering, and solution workflow design for GenAI/ML projects
Proven ability to drive client engagement and align development teams toward a technical roadmap
Proficient in programming with Python, Langchain, and SQL
Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS
Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with business SMEs

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do You want to be part of transforming how we work with AI and machine learning at scale at Danske Bank?

Are you a skilled ML engineer with a proven track record of deploying and managing Machine Learning models in multiple environments? Do you have a passion for automation, scalability and for optimizing ML workflows? If so, you might just be the one we are looking for.

Danske Bank has a clear strategy that focuses on growth and profitability. Data Driven Danske is the one underlying data strategy for the bank; a comprehensive vision and foundation for building and harnessing data & analytics capabilities to enable delivery of the business strategy in a sustainable and repeatable fashion.

From an AI/ML perspective, this is what we in Group Data & Analytics have committed to; namely to enable the organisation to adopt and scale AI/ML by defining and executing the one -group-wide data strategy, incl. how AI/algorithms transform and produces lower-level abstractions of the same.

In Data Science & AI (part of Group Data & Analytics) we are ramping up to build a highly specialized team that partners with our core business- and development teams to deliver solutions in e.g. our product offering such as the Mobile Bank, e-Bank, website and other tooling for frontline advisors.

About The Role

Currently, we are looking for strong candidates to help push our commercial agenda with a wide range of models, that identify customer needs, used to present to the customer their Next-Best-Action. Using data from customer interaction (messages, chats and calls) we develop ML solutions that help provide automatic replies and digital routing to create a better customer experience and lower costs from manual processes/handling. But this is only the beginning!

In Danske Bank we have a strategy to migrate to public cloud with AWS. You will play a vital role in defining and building the future Data Science platform, thereby to help accelerate the impact of Machine Leaning and AI across Danske Bank.

Anchored in Data Science & AI (Group Data & Analytics), but teaming up with business teams, we ensure that not only do we build the right things, but we also build it the right way.

About You


You would be able to tick of most of the points below (but not necessarily all):
Deep knowledge (5+ years) of MLOps from previous hands-on roles or solid experience as an ML Engineer.
Understanding of, and ability to think , IT architectures for scale.
Works independently, but thrives in teaming-up with skilled colleagues.
Ability to set a product vision and deliver on a roadmap.
Self-driven with an ability to work individually and with others in the team and organisation.
Outcome-oriented with a focus on delivering.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to bring the right stakeholders together.
Curious about product development, technology trends with a thirst for knowledge and self-improvement
Deployment and training of LLM’s


Experience with following or similar:


Python
Spark/PySpark
Airflow
SQL
Public Cloud providers (preferably AWS)
FAST API
MLFlow
Monitoring frameworks (Prometheus, Graphana etc.)
Containerisation (ex. Kubernetees, Docker, Openshift)
CI/CD pipelines
Git/Azure DevOps


About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a data driven bank. To make better decisions - for our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

If this sounds like you, don't hesitate to apply!

If you want to hear more about this exciting role, do not hesitate contact Michael Thruesen on mail; mthru@danskebank.dk
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer at new Human-Centered Social Network Startup
Description:
At Lifebonder, we’re on a mission to break social media addiction, fake personas, cyber-bullying, cancel culture, and loneliness by providing a Mesaverse that lives up to the promise of what social media can be: A safe place to facilitate human connections rather than replace them.

We want to make the world a better place by filling a growing need for direct socializing outside social media - connecting people in friendships that are human, profound, and meaningful. LifeBonder makes it easy for people to connect in a deeper reality through shared spaces, values, and goals because our vision is to build social bonds in real life.

Job brief

We are actively searching for a talented and experienced Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to join our team.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the development and implementation of cutting-edge artificial intelligence.

Your responsibilities will involve designing and constructing sophisticated machine learning models, as well as refining and updating systems.

In order to thrive in this position, you must possess exceptional skills in statistics and programming, as well as a deep understanding of data science and software engineering principles.

Your ultimate objective will be to create highly efficient self-learning applications that can adapt and evolve over time, pushing the boundaries of AI technology. Join us and be at the forefront of innovation in the field of machine learning.

Responsibilities


Study and transform data science prototypes
Design machine learning systems
Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
Develop machine learning application according to requirements
Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
Run machine learning tests and experiments
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
Train and retrain systems when necessary
Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks
Keep abreast of developments in the field


Requirements And Skills


Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role
Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms
Ability to write robust code in Python, Java and R
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master’s degree is a plus


What We Offer


We are a small team of endlessly dedicated developers offering a fun and friendly work environment where everyone is equal.
We offer real-world work experience and exciting challenges where you can make a real difference.
Excellent recommendations and when you’re ready to move on, we’ve got your back.
Full-time hires at a later date.


For more information or questions please contact us at development@lifebonder.com or phone number
Show more

Title: Data Scientist til Personlige Indholdsanbefalinger hos TV 2 Play
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du klar til at tage del i en spændende rejse med TV 2 Play? Mere end 1,1 million danskere har et TV2 Play-abonnement, og i gennemsnit bruger 75% dagligt vores apps. Vi vil gerne tage vores personaliserede indholdsanbefalinger til næste niveau.

Om teamet

Som Data Scientist bliver du en central del af vores produktudviklingsteam, Play Content Recommendation. Teamet består af to andre Data Scientists, tre Software Engineers og en Product Manager og er kendetegnet ved en høj grad af fællesskab. Teamets hovedfokus er at levere personlige indholdsanbefalinger til vores VOD-streamingtjeneste og kommercielle e-mail flows. Sammen skaber vi fremtidens digitale oplevelser gennem optimerede machine learning-modeller, der gavner både brugerne og vores forretningsmål.

Om rollen

Dine primære ansvarsområder vil være at:



Designe, implementere og optimere prædiktive modeller, som understøtter vores personaliserede indholdsanbefalinger. 
Analysere brugeradfærd og data for at identificere nye muligheder og forbedringer. 
Sikre gennemsigtighed i beslutningsproces i modellerne.
Samarbejde med Product Managers, Software Engineers og UX-designere for at integrere dataindsigter i brugeroplevelsen. 



Du får mulighed for at arbejde med komplekse teknologier inden for machine learning og big data på en omskiftelig arbejdsplads, hvor innovation og kreativitet er i højsædet. Her tilbydes attraktiv løn og benefits samt fleksible arbejdstider, samtidig med at du indtager en central rolle i et team, hvor din indsats har direkte indflydelse på mere end 1 million brugere.

Du kan enten have din daglige arbejdsgang på vores hovedkontor på Kvægtorvet i Odense, eller vores københavnske kontor på Teglholmen. Har du sidstnævnte, vil du skulle forvente at have 1-2 arbejdsdage i Odense om ugen.

Om dig

Vi leder efter dig, der er passioneret omkring at omsætte komplekse data til indsigter og forbedre brugeroplevelser med avancerede machine learning-modeller, har solid erfaring inden for data science, og som vil være en del af et topteam, hvor kompetencer og dedikation går hånd i hånd med hjælpsomhed og at have det sjovt.

Du ser samarbejde og dialog som en forudsætning for at lykkes, og du er altid klar til at finde løsninger, selv når det er noget nyt og uprøvet. Med en tro på, at frihed og fleksibilitet skaber de bedste resultater, planlægger og administrerer du effektivt din tid. Din nysgerrighed driver dig til konstant læring og udvikling, og du sætter en ære i at dele din viden med andre.

Derudover kommer du med:



En kandidatgrad inden for statistik, datavidenskab, computer science eller lignende.
Solid erfaring med udvikling og implementering af machine learning-modeller i produktionsmiljøer.
Solide Python skills og kendskab til biblioteker som numpy, scikit-learn eller lignende.
En analytisk, struktureret og dyb forståelse for dataanalyse og modeltuning.
Evnen til at kommunikere komplekse tekniske koncepter på en klar og forståelig måde til ikke-tekniske interessenter.
En nysgerrighed og interesse i at forstå brugeradfærd og anvende denne viden til innovation.



Om TV 2 som teknologiarbejdsplads

I TV 2s teknologiske område arbejder flere end 350 medarbejdere dedikeret til at understøtte og realisere den koncernstrategiske målsætning om 1,3 millioner Play-abonnenter i 2025. Målsætningen, der udspringer af 2025-strategien 'TV 2 Play til alle', forudsætter et solidt teknologisk fundament, der gør det muligt for TV 2 også i fremtiden at levere dansk kvalitetsindhold og public service, som danskerne har let adgang til og interesse i at samles om.

TV 2 investerer derfor i disse år massivt i udviklingen og driften af hele den teknologiske værdikæde fra medieteknologi og tv-produktion til digital produktudvikling. Alt sammen med det formål at sikre, at vi imødekommer danskernes behov og forventninger i et omskifteligt marked med stigende, international konkurrence. Teknologiorganisationen er placeret i både Odense og København, og vi beskæftiger blandt andre Software Engineers, UX-designere, Product Managers, Entreprise Architects, produktionsspecialister og Data Scientists.

Søg rollen

Du sender din ansøgning med CV via formularen nedenunder. Ansøgningsfristen er 30. september 2024, og du kan forvente at høre fra os i umiddelbar forlængelse deraf.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!


Show more

Om teamet

Som Data Scientist bliver du en central del af vores produktudviklingsteam, Play Content Recommendation. Teamet består af to andre Data Scientists, tre Software Engineers og en Product Manager og er kendetegnet ved en høj grad af fællesskab. Teamets hovedfokus er at levere personlige indholdsanbefalinger til vores VOD-streamingtjeneste og kommercielle e-mail flows. Sammen skaber vi fremtidens digitale oplevelser gennem optimerede machine learning-modeller, der gavner både brugerne og vores forretningsmål.

Om rollen

Dine primære ansvarsområder vil være at:


  • Designe, implementere og optimere prædiktive modeller, som understøtter vores personaliserede indholdsanbefalinger. 
  • Analysere brugeradfærd og data for at identificere nye muligheder og forbedringer. 
  • Sikre gennemsigtighed i beslutningsproces i modellerne.
  • Samarbejde med Product Managers, Software Engineers og UX-designere for at integrere dataindsigter i brugeroplevelsen. 


Du får mulighed for at arbejde med komplekse teknologier inden for machine learning og big data på en omskiftelig arbejdsplads, hvor innovation og kreativitet er i højsædet. Her tilbydes attraktiv løn og benefits samt fleksible arbejdstider, samtidig med at du indtager en central rolle i et team, hvor din indsats har direkte indflydelse på mere end 1 million brugere.

Du kan enten have din daglige arbejdsgang på vores hovedkontor på Kvægtorvet i Odense, eller vores københavnske kontor på Teglholmen. Har du sidstnævnte, vil du skulle forvente at have 1-2 arbejdsdage i Odense om ugen.

Om dig

Vi leder efter dig, der er passioneret omkring at omsætte komplekse data til indsigter og forbedre brugeroplevelser med avancerede machine learning-modeller, har solid erfaring inden for data science, og som vil være en del af et topteam, hvor kompetencer og dedikation går hånd i hånd med hjælpsomhed og at have det sjovt.

Du ser samarbejde og dialog som en forudsætning for at lykkes, og du er altid klar til at finde løsninger, selv når det er noget nyt og uprøvet. Med en tro på, at frihed og fleksibilitet skaber de bedste resultater, planlægger og administrerer du effektivt din tid. Din nysgerrighed driver dig til konstant læring og udvikling, og du sætter en ære i at dele din viden med andre.

Derudover kommer du med:


  • En kandidatgrad inden for statistik, datavidenskab, computer science eller lignende.
  • Solid erfaring med udvikling og implementering af machine learning-modeller i produktionsmiljøer.
  • Solide Python skills og kendskab til biblioteker som numpy, scikit-learn eller lignende.
  • En analytisk, struktureret og dyb forståelse for dataanalyse og modeltuning.
  • Evnen til at kommunikere komplekse tekniske koncepter på en klar og forståelig måde til ikke-tekniske interessenter.
  • En nysgerrighed og interesse i at forstå brugeradfærd og anvende denne viden til innovation.


Om TV 2 som teknologiarbejdsplads

I TV 2s teknologiske område arbejder flere end 350 medarbejdere dedikeret til at understøtte og realisere den koncernstrategiske målsætning om 1,3 millioner Play-abonnenter i 2025. Målsætningen, der udspringer af 2025-strategien 'TV 2 Play til alle', forudsætter et solidt teknologisk fundament, der gør det muligt for TV 2 også i fremtiden at levere dansk kvalitetsindhold og public service, som danskerne har let adgang til og interesse i at samles om.

TV 2 investerer derfor i disse år massivt i udviklingen og driften af hele den teknologiske værdikæde fra medieteknologi og tv-produktion til digital produktudvikling. Alt sammen med det formål at sikre, at vi imødekommer danskernes behov og forventninger i et omskifteligt marked med stigende, international konkurrence. Teknologiorganisationen er placeret i både Odense og København, og vi beskæftiger blandt andre Software Engineers, UX-designere, Product Managers, Entreprise Architects, produktionsspecialister og Data Scientists.

Søg rollen

Du sender din ansøgning med CV via formularen nedenunder. Ansøgningsfristen er 30. september 2024, og du kan forvente at høre fra os i umiddelbar forlængelse deraf.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 2 - 10 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer at new Human-Centered Social Network Startup
Description:
At Lifebonder, we’re on a mission to break social media addiction, fake personas, cyber-bullying, cancel culture, and loneliness by providing a Mesaverse that lives up to the promise of what social media can be: A safe place to facilitate human connections rather than replace them.

We want to make the world a better place by filling a growing need for direct socializing outside social media - connecting people in friendships that are human, profound, and meaningful. LifeBonder makes it easy for people to connect in a deeper reality through shared spaces, values, and goals because our vision is to build social bonds in real life.

Job brief

We are actively searching for a talented and experienced Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to join our team.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the development and implementation of cutting-edge artificial intelligence.

Your responsibilities will involve designing and constructing sophisticated machine learning models, as well as refining and updating systems.

In order to thrive in this position, you must possess exceptional skills in statistics and programming, as well as a deep understanding of data science and software engineering principles.

Your ultimate objective will be to create highly efficient self-learning applications that can adapt and evolve over time, pushing the boundaries of AI technology. Join us and be at the forefront of innovation in the field of machine learning.

Responsibilities


Study and transform data science prototypes
Design machine learning systems
Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
Develop machine learning application according to requirements
Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
Run machine learning tests and experiments
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
Train and retrain systems when necessary
Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks
Keep abreast of developments in the field


Requirements And Skills


Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role
Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms
Ability to write robust code in Python, Java and R
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master’s degree is a plus


What We Offer


We are a small team of endlessly dedicated developers offering a fun and friendly work environment where everyone is equal.
We offer real-world work experience and exciting challenges where you can make a real difference.
Excellent recommendations and when you’re ready to move on, we’ve got your back.
Full-time hires at a later date.


For more information or questions please contact us at development@lifebonder.com or phone number
Show more

Title: AI Engineer - Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Engineer - Copenhagen:

AI is the word on everyone's lips right now, especially when it comes to how we can leverage and utilise data.

Question is, how do you know which business is serious about their AI strategy?

I am now working with an innovation driven start-up who are in the process of releasing their first AI product to market.

Specialising in process automation while taking key details into account like compliance and risk monitoring. Helping to smoothly integrate data into a tailored, data driven product.

Offering a one-stop-shop platform for you to get to know your business and make the most out of your data!

You will be joining a cross-collaborative team who all contribute towards the businesses evolution.

Having a start-up feel brings you fresh insight through your new, highly talented colleagues!

What we hope to see from you:


Previous experience with practical AI deployment
Previous experience in python coding and problem solving
Skilled in modern data science and machine learning techniques
The ability to design, deploy and demonstrate your ideas to colleagues
The ability to deliver as an individual and in a team
Confidence to share your opinion and spar with both tech and business driven team members
Strong communicator with fluency in English (written & verbal)


The office is based in central Copenhagen with a high level of flexibility to make your working week suit you and your personal life.

If you want know more, please reach out!

d.nichol@nigelfrank.com
Show more

Title: Python Backend Developer - Remote
Description:
Location: Latin America/Europe - Permanent Remote

Experience: 6 - 15 Years

Role Type: Contracting Full Time (40 Hrs/week)

Overlap Hours: 8 Hours PST time

Contract Duration: 3-6 Months

Mandatory Skills

Python- 5 years,

Django- 5 years,

SQL-5 years.

Hands-on experience with the AWS cloud is mandatory

Total years of exp- 6+ years experience mandatory

Required Skills


7+ years of experience in software development - ( Purely backend )
Coding experience in server-side programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, Ruby) as well as database languages (SQL)
Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)
Past experience and success in building and supporting scalable APIs, services, or applications
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


About The Role

A globally recognised firm is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join their Carriers team! The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, he/she will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for their team and the Engineering team.

Responsibility

Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs that can handle millions of requests a day.


Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns from the data model, queuing of jobs, application layering and container-based software distribution.
Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
Participate in peer reviews, testing and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics to ensure performance and quality.
Work with a sense of urgency and iterate quickly in an agile process.
Mentor more junior engineers on engineering best practices.
Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges and translate those into technical solutions.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
There is no quality healthcare without a quality dialogue. Today, that dialogue is broken; we need you to help us fix it.

Doctors and nurses across the world are facing unprecedented challenges. When we meet them, they're dealing with heavy workloads, extensive paperwork, and the pressure of performing well, which in healthcare, can have dire consequences. This system is gradually undermining the passion and autonomy of our dedicated healthcare professionals, who entered this field to provide care, not to clerk.

Corti has built the world's premier AI assistant for healthcare providers. It listens in during patient dialogue, takes notes, writes summaries, journals and does quality assurance. When information is missed, or risk is high, it offers nudges and prompts to help steer the dialogue back on the right path. Entire countries trust Corti to deliver better healthcare, and our AI has already helped millions of patients, but we are just getting started.

At Corti, we are growing fast and always looking for skillful people to ensure we go in the right direction. If you enjoy working in an autonomous and collaborative team, guided by shared values and a willingness to act, iterate, and learn, then join us at Corti as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer

📌 As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of our machine learning R&D team and work closely with our product teams. The machine learning R&D team consists of seasoned engineers as well as several Ph.D. students and postdocs collaborating with Danish and international universities. Our product teams are cross-functional and own product discovery and delivery end-to-end.

You can read more about our research and publications here: https://corti.ai/company/research

Our vision, products, and solutions to enrich patient consultations are described here: https://corti.ai/

In this role, you will work alongside our other machine learning engineers and researchers, developing new models, implementing state-of-the-art research outputs, and translating those outputs into tangible product outcomes. For example, you might be involved in the prototyping a new machine learning-based product feature in collaboration with other teams. Or you might work independently on taking state-of-the-art research and assessing how well it works in Corti’s domain. There are many possibilities and plenty of room for creativity and bringing in your own ideas.

The impact you'll have


Develop prototypes based on cutting-edge applied machine learning working on audio, text, and structured data sources.
Own the technical translation of state-of-the-art machine learning innovations to inform the development of new product features.
Design and implement well-defined APIs for new machine learning tools to make them available for customers and across the organization.
Participate in research ventures and drive publication at top machine learning venues or impactful digital medicine journals.
Improve healthcare globally as part of your daily work.


You'll thrive in this role if you have the following


A higher university degree or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related interdisciplinary field.
In-depth experience with Python and strong command of data structures and algorithms in order to contribute to production-grade code.
In-depth knowledge of one or more of the major machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow).
Ability to manage machine learning research projects and clearly communicate outcomes to technical and non-technical audiences.


Nice to have


Publication history at top machine learning venues (e.g., NeurIPS, ACL, or digital medicine journals) that shows that you can drive research projects.
Hands-on experience with automatic speech recognition or natural language processing.


Practicalities


The work location for this position is preferred in Copenhagen, but we can be flexible with the right candidate.
This is a full-time position, starting as soon as possible.


Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

🤝 Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.﻿

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we’re passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we’re looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you’ll consider applying!
Show more

For example, you might be involved in the prototyping a new machine learning-based product feature in collaboration with other teams. Or you might work independently on taking state-of-the-art research and assessing how well it works in Corti’s domain. There are many possibilities and plenty of room for creativity and bringing in your own ideas.

The impact you'll have

  • Develop prototypes based on cutting-edge applied machine learning working on audio, text, and structured data sources.
  • Own the technical translation of state-of-the-art machine learning innovations to inform the development of new product features.
  • Design and implement well-defined APIs for new machine learning tools to make them available for customers and across the organization.
  • Participate in research ventures and drive publication at top machine learning venues or impactful digital medicine journals.
  • Improve healthcare globally as part of your daily work.

You'll thrive in this role if you have the following

  • A higher university degree or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related interdisciplinary field.
  • In-depth experience with Python and strong command of data structures and algorithms in order to contribute to production-grade code.
  • In-depth knowledge of one or more of the major machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow).
  • Ability to manage machine learning research projects and clearly communicate outcomes to technical and non-technical audiences.

Nice to have

  • Publication history at top machine learning venues (e.g., NeurIPS, ACL, or digital medicine journals) that shows that you can drive research projects.
  • Hands-on experience with automatic speech recognition or natural language processing.

Practicalities

  • The work location for this position is preferred in Copenhagen, but we can be flexible with the right candidate.
  • This is a full-time position, starting as soon as possible.

Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

🤝 Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.﻿

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we’re passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we’re looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you’ll consider applying!

Title: Data Science Student Assistant
Description:
Drive meaningful change

Are you a curious and passionate student who just started your master’s degree and eager to dive into the world of data science? Join us as a Data Science Student Assistant and play a key role in maintaining and improving our forecasting models, assisting with model development, and advancing our data science infrastructure. If you're ready to make an impact while growing your skills, we are looking forward to hearing from you!




Get a glimpse of our world

As a Data Science Student, you'll join an international team dedicated to developing innovative, data-driven solutions to core business challenges. Our diverse group ensures that the entire organization relies on high-quality data products for decision-making.

In this role, you'll need curiosity and a passion for data exploration. You should be eager to uncover insights and communicate your findings effectively to non-technical audiences. You'll take ownership of your tasks and find motivation in delivering impactful results, by using tools like:

A diverse range of Machine Learning models, including both supervised and unsupervised learning.
A robust Data Science Tech Stack: Python, Jupyter Lab/Notebooks, Docker.
A cutting-edge Cloud Stack: Microsoft Azure, Spark, Databricks, Delta Lake.




Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

You'll work closely with stakeholders across the organization, as well as with business intelligence developers, analysts, and data engineers, to ensure our models and infrastructure meet the highest standards.

As a Data Science Student Assistant, you will have the opportunity to:

Model Maintenance: Actively maintain, monitor, improve, and document our forecasting models.
Model Development: Assist with the initial phases of developing new forecasting models.
Data Science Research: Conduct research on emerging methods, tools, and models, and share your findings with the team.
Technical Infrastructure Development: Contribute to maintaining and improving our cutting-edge data science infrastructure.




Fuel for your success in the role

We are looking for someone who is curious about data and passionate about uncovering insights that drive business decisions. Ideally you will have:

Education: You have about 1,5 or 2 years left of your master’s degree in a data science-related field (e.g., computer science, IT, mathematics/statistics, economics).
Technical Skills:

Intermediate-level Python programming skills.

Data Science - machine learning, data wrangling, data analysis, and visualization.

Communication: Good oral and written communication skills in English.




Additional Interests (not required but beneficial):

Knowledge of SQL, Spark, ETL processes, CI/CD processes, Linux commands, Web APIs, MLOps, and Dashboards.




Would you like to know more about us?

Are you the right match for this position? Then please follow the link and apply for this exciting position before the application deadline on September 27th. Interviews will be conducted throughout the application period. The position is to be filled as soon as possible, and we process applications continuously.

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager, Mihai Popovici, Data Science Team Lead, mihai.popovici@abacusmedicine.com.




Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.




Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,300 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Show more
